description:
At work, we do little birthday treats. It's always the bday person's choice, so this time, we had a cake from Victoria Pastry. We celebrated on Tuesday, October 23rd around 2pm.

We got their Princess Cake: made with a Vanilla sponge cake (triple sec soaked) with a layer of raspberry jam, vanilla custard, and whipped cream, draped in green almond marzipan. I've never had a princess cake before working at this office and I have to say, it's really tasty. Light, but still decadent. Plus, the triple sec soaked cake gives it a lot of flavor and moisture. I'm not big on marzipan, but it works in this case. Actually, the combination of the custard, jam, and whipped cream all work really well together.

Definitely a great bakery for princess cakes. We always pick one up here every year for this particular bday.
author: Elena N.

description:
The princess cake was far beyond anything that I expected.

I am not a huge sweet or cake person, but I tried this based on reviews and was so impressed by how mouthwateringly moist it was.

It produced one of those eating moments where all thoughts stop, time stops, and the center of the world is what is touching your tastebuds.
author: Ken L.

description:
The quintessential go-to or stop by place if you are even remotely in the mood for some sweet deliciousness from this iconic Italian pastry shop. 

The cookies are amazing! Italian old-school type. There is no high-end fanciness, but just amazing eyes-popping-out-of-your-skull flavors offered for purchase. Awesomeness defined!

The individual cake slices most often our weakness when here. The Princess and Strawberry layered whipped cream are our personal favorites, while we will often succumb to the temptation of another equally looking sinful selection while we have chosen wisely. 

Having more than two or three different slices with a coffee each is 'how we roll' most often.

The extra bonus in going to this venue is that right around the corner is XOX truffles. I will run down there to grab a take-out box of their wonderful truffles after I get my fill of the sweet decadence here @ Victoria! 

When there are TWO iconic sweet stops within a block of each other in Beautiful and Historic North Beach, you know that, Yes: There is indeed a God! 

HOW GOOD IS THAT??
author: william s.

description:
There is a nice ambience and great location to people watch and listen to live music coming from the restaurant across the street. When you visit Victoria pastry you are able to enjoy your purchase indoor or outdoor's. This is always helpful depending on your mood. I'm not sure of the flow of business in the morning, if they're missing out on business because this place opens up at 7 AM. Most people are halfway to work by 7am. If they would like to broaden their customer base it may be helpful if they opened up at 6 AM when people are on their way to work.

I ordered a quarter pound of cookies to go, it was a mix and while waiting for a friend I ordered the cheesecake. The cheesecake was fair however since I'm from the East Coast and very familiar with New York cheesecake or cheesecake made with Philadelphia cream cheese this version was lackluster. It had a nice texture but lacked flavor. The cookies that included a Linzer tart that was eaten when I arrived back home in the Philadelphia area. Again the cookies that I ordered were fair, I'm not really impressed with any of the items that I purchased!

When ordering it may be helpful to have a small sign in front of each selection of cookies so the customer is aware of what the options are. It's kind of annoying to the point at each cookie and ask, 'what is this?' and 'what is it made of?' The signs hanging above the workers written in a chalkboard style is not that helpful. But it's a small business I wish the very best
author: Leah M.

description:
More adventuring in North Beach led me to this shop. I'm not sure how I didn't see it here before, as I visit the truffle shop around the corner every time I'm in town, but today I did see it. I had just checked into my hotel, and taken the bus up to this neighborhood to get truffles as my first SF destination (because priorities) and I decided to take a quick detour for a pastry or cookie or something first. It's the kind of thing that a trip to San Francisco *should* involve. Having delicious destinations, but being open to trying all kinds of new things as they come up. Finding cute bakeries and sharing a few treats while seated at a small table, watching people walk by. Sipping, smiling, sampling.

Roll the dice and sometimes you lose, but not today. I walked in and saw that they have cookies for sale by the pound, and I ordered one of every single cookie on the middle shelf. They happily obliged and I ended up with a menagerie of delightful little cookies. They were all very European--small, cute, and would have been perfect to sample, share, and compare notes. But I was flying solo today and ate them all myself. I sat down at the cute table out front and ate every last one all by myself. I closed my eyes and felt the sun on my face, the breeze in the air, and the flavors in my mouth. It was aaaaalmost perfect.

Of the cookies, the lunette is the most interesting, with its heart shape and window between layers that lets you peek into the jam. They're gorgeous. But the real winner was the almond flavored one, with the pine nut topping and the amazing chew. I can't even describe the perfect balance of sweet and texture and crunch. I could eat a dozen right now. 

This really is the kind of place you just pop in and try. Their signature princess cake looks tremendous and you can try a slice, or there are a few others that were very tempting. The eclairs (choose from cream or custard) also called my name, but I will come back to share this sort of experience with others in the future; there's much to try.

I left, and then went and got my truffles. And then I wandered and tried three other places on a whim. But there's so much more to explore, so I'll be back to the neighborhood, and back to Victoria.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Food: I LOVE RED VELVET AND THIS PLACE GOT IT RIGHT!!! Not too dry, perfectly moist, and just soooo delicious, I ordered 1 right after I finished the 1st one! The buttercream is good too, not overwhelmingly sweet at all and compliments the cupcake quite well!  My mom ordered their tiramisu and said they also got that right too.  Not too watery or too thick, and the perfect amount of rum in it along with a perfect even layer of cocoa on top.

Service: super fast, no line despite the amazing goods available for munching on, and friendly

Atmosphere: cozy, though a bit dark.  Not much space to sit down here, as this is more of a grab-and-go bakery, but that's just fine with me.  I highly recommend coming here if you want dessert after chowing down on some Italian foods from nearby.
author: Savannah H.

description: Oh wow, just wow!!!  I stopped by this local coffee and pastry shop as I was walking to Fisherman's Warf and I'm so glad I did!  What a cute local place.  The cappuccino was to die for and it had a perfect heart on top.  The sweet lady working all by herself behind the counter was calmly handling the crowd and making all the special drinks for everyone.  The home made pastry looked fabulous and I just had to get a couple of pieces as did my friend.  Again, it was all delicious .... I can't wait to go back when I visit San Francisco.
author: Rima M.

description:
I come to San Francisco 5 times a year - my old stomping ground when I was young.  On the first day back in the City, I always head directly to Victoria to get my fix of cannoli and coffee. That is it!  After I have my due cannoli and cafe, the world is just right - and they do it right!  No need for anymore fancy food.

Keep making this old favorite, and the old guys like me will keep coming back.
author: Spencer C.

description: The most delicious cannoli ever!! Perfectly crisp, not too sweet, love the texture of the chocolate chips. Whipped cream eclair is also great and a nice lighter alternative to the traditional eclair. Delicious and everything tasted very fresh!!! Nice strong coffee is also a nice plus.
author: Yin H.

description:
AN ABSOLUTELY MUST DO! DELICIOUS ITALIAN PASTRIES & Cappuccino. Located in the Little Italy section of San Francisco called North Beach. The most popular items in here are their PRINCESS CAKE & CANNOLIS. The PRINCESS CAKE has Raspberries,  Custard , Whipped  Cream, Triple Sec, & almond paste. It is a beautiful spring green color. DELICIOUSSSS! Their Cannolis are Ricotta filled with Chocolate Chips. Also DELICIOUSSSS! They also have great Cappuccinos. They have table & chairs inside & outside this little Italian cafe. This is a great people watching spot.  
It used to be, you had to have mega bucks & be really rich to have the Good Life, not anymore. The Game has changed. You've been Upgraded. Now You Can 
Live Like a King on a Limited Budget!
author: Stephen Z.

description:
After hearing Sunday service, I stopped by to get some breakfast. I ordered an iced coffee and a custard filled eclair. I am not much of a coffee drinker but it was smooth enough for me. The eclair was fresh and not too sweet. I can taste a hint of bitterness from the chocolate, which is a good thing for me.

As I was about leave, an elderly local lady suggested to try the princess cake. I do not want to miss an opportunity, I got myself a slice to go. The first bite was heavenly. The jam, cream, sponge cake and marzipan mingle together in my mouth. No regrets.

Next time I visit San Francisco, I will definitely be back to try the rest of their pastries. No wonder its been around for so long (1914 to be exact).
author: Yammie B.

description: This does not happen often that I am completely stunned by something unexpected, but it just happened.  While strolling through San Francisco I came across this little bakery in the North Beach area.  They had a very nice selection of homemade pastries along with your typical custom coffee selections.  I wanted to purchase everything but actually settled on a simple blueberry scone to go.  I made it about a block away and took my first bite.  OMG! It was breath taking!  It was flaking, buttery, with the right amount of sweetness.  I have tried scones all over the world, including some very fine authentic scones with jam and clotted cream in a 16th century tea house in Arundel, UK.  This by far is the ABSOLUTE best scone I have ever had anywhere in the world!  If you like scones, or homemade pastries in general, this is a must stop.
author: Tim B.

description: Right across the park from Tony's, we headed in to quench our sweet tooth.   I had the chocolate coconut walnut  cookie. Was moist enough and was good.  The lemon bars fell apart a little too easy but tasted good.  The help was great and the pastries were good. I think you figured out this place is good
author: Javier L.

description: Excellent find. Wonderful bakery with fresh chocolate covered strawberries and strawberry shortcake
author: Alan S.

description:
We seldom eat European desserts so this visit is a rare treat.

Tiramisu -  the best, not too sweet, full of espresso, moist 
Princess cake - beautiful to the eye, I like almond but marzipan is too sweet
Croissant -  just meh
Apple strudel - too sweet and gooey, ended up discarding it (I am a frugal person, not natural for me to throw away food)

Next time will try their cookies to go
pignoli cookies (pine nut cookies)
amaretti cookies (almond cookes)
author: Connie W.

description: I couldn't resist visiting this bakery to take a look at their princess cakes, but we ended up picking up some other goodies as well. We chose a sun-drenched spot on the seating area outside to enjoy the pastries. The princess cake is probably the most ~ aesthetic ~ due to its bright green marzipan covering and intricate frosting lol. It tasted okay, but the marzipan was a little overpowering. The cake itself was fluffy and moist. The apple strudel was good, but would've been better warmed up since it was so hard to tear apart. And the cannoli was different from any other cannoli I've had - it's less sweet and you can really taste the ricotta in the filling. Our favorite was the cheesecake, which was creamy, dense, and perfectly sweet.
author: Jen L.

description:
Review #800, yeahHhHhbaby!

First of all, I'm slightly bias to cannoli's because I'm married to an Italian, but that also means we have high standards when it comes to Italian pastries. *wink. With this said....if HE says it's good, trust me folks..., IT'S GOOD! ;)

I've never been a huge fan of cannoli's until my hubby. I always thought they were too rich and too sweet. The cannoli's from Victoria's are nothing like that. The cannoli's found at Victoria's are freshly made everyday and you can actually taste the freshness. The texture of the cream filling has a thickness that pairs well with the outer shell. The flakeyness of the puff pastry is perfect! Every bite is deliciously decadent, and the puff pastry stays in contact with every bite. Other cannoli's usually break and start to flake off- not at Victoria's! Buy your cannoli's here, they are worth every penny!

Here at Victoria's they also brew up some pretty good coffee. I tried their latte, which was perfect with my freshly made cannoli's. Fresh, that's the word that comes to mind when I have items from this bakery.
author: Lene N.

description: This place was nice and cozy.  Great quick stop for coffee and a pastry!
author: Jim P.

description: Victoria Pastry has got a number of sweets to choose from, but their princess cake is what they're known for. It's very sweet and rich - even though we ate ours the next day, it was still fresh.
author: Casey S.

description: I stopped by briefly for a snack and it was lovely. I had a slice of princess cake which was just incredible. The martzipan was very tasty and the whole thing was delicious. It was a bit pricey though. The establishment is super adorable and the service was fine. There is a restroom available for customers. I recommend it if you need a special treat.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Had a quick iced coffee and tiramisu on a little table out front. Both were delicious. If you're looking for a quick "pick me up" in the late afternoon, as I was, I suggest you try it.
author: Lori R.

description:
Jamie W. got me one of their magical St. Honore cakes a couple of birthdays back (photo: http://bit.ly/2i5fzH0), so Victoria is never too far away from my thoughts...or my hips. The original location at Vallejo and Stockton was actually one of the first places I Yelped over a decade ago, so it's about time I revisited my ancient review with fresh eyes. Well, I don't know if my eyes are so fresh anymore, but the Pignoli cookies sure are. It's still among my favorite cookies because of the splash of amaretto that infuses the chewy dough amid all those toasted pine nuts (photo: http://bit.ly/2i5m4cJ).

I also like the Biscotti here because they're compact, unadorned with chocolate, and not a challenge to expensive dental work (photo: http://bit.ly/2i5gOpN). The simple baked goods work best for us, but Christmas did bring some more elaborate treats like trees and stars with candied sugars (photo: http://bit.ly/2jfTcwm) and unreasonably happy gingerbread men with rainbow sprinkle berets (photo: http://bit.ly/2joQkkY). Their move to Filbert Street a few years back certainly makes it easier to get the cookies if you're hanging around Washington Square Park, which provides the idyllic opportunity for noshing on these goodies.

So why have I taken a star away? I guess for me, something's been missing since the move, that hurly-burly sense of abbondanza when it was in the true heart of North Beach. It's almost too tranquil being down the street from Saints Peter & Paul Church (photo: http://bit.ly/2iUDhHk), but I imagine spiraling real estate prices in the city forced the move. And at the end of the day, we're lucky this old-school Italian bakery didn't close or move to the 'burbs (although in fact, there is another one up in Greenbrae). Hey, as long as I can get that St. Honore cake every once in a while when I deserve one, I'll be just fine.

FOOD - 4.5 stars...it's the simpler cookies that satisfy the most...unless someone buys me a St. Honore cake...anybody?
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...almost too tranquil in here
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient
TOTAL - 4 stars...something sweet would be nice
author: Ed U.

description: I can't begin to tell you how amazing this bakery is. I ordered my son a vanilla birthday cake with confetti sprinkles on it, and paid for it about 1 week in advance. When I sent someone to pick it up, the bakery accidentally had it booked for the week after my son's party. So, we bought a tiny chocolate one instead... my son hates chocolate. But- we made it work, until the pastry chef called me to tell me how he was sorry this mixup happened and baked a fresh cake and delivered it to the venue! I mean, how amazing is it that we had the chance to get that kind of action taken?! And the cake was magnificent!! That bakery was a special part of the day and I thank them so much!
author: Naomi A.

description:
I grew up in an Italian (and Jewish) neighborhood in Queens NYC. Of course I've search for quality Italian bakery goods in SF but no dice. So I save my fix for trips back home. 

Imagine my surprise when I discovered Victoria Pastry Company. This is THE REAL DEAL. They fill the Cannoli fresh when you order and the quality is top notch. I tried the Fedora (chocolate cake with rum) as well. Perfection... moist, light, not too sweet.

I have yet to try the cookies so I'm holding my breath on that one but I suspect a home run given the batting average lol
author: V H.

description:
Cute little bakery in the heart of Little Italy.  They have a nice variety of cookies and cakes.  We were getting ready to get on a plane when we stopped in, so only grabbed a bag of cookies, but everything looked delicious.

I'm Italian and used to eating hard cookies, the biscotti and nutella hazelnut cookies are definitely what we call "dunkers" - you'll need a hot coffee to soften them up, but they were really good.  My daughter loves Wedding cookies, so we got a bunch.  They were light and crunchy, perfectly sized and very tasty.   The Amarretti were nice and crunchy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  The Pignoli (pine nut) cookies were my favorite, super moist and chewy, wish we had bought more.
If Victoria's ever starts to deliver out of town, I'm going to be in trouble!
author: D D.

description: I used to live in this neighborhood long time ago so it was nice to come back and get some delicious slice of cake from Victoria. I was so excited! I came at 7.25 pm, they close at 8. The girl at the register said they can't make coffee because she cleaned the espresso machine already and sent me to their other location. Are you serious? Then she also said that I can't get my cake for here because they close in 30 min she wants to clean the place now! Do you know anything about customer service??? Keep losing your money because I was not the only one who was refused service.
author: Kate E.

description: I don't know why this place doesn't have 5 starts, because it should. Clean, simple, and delicious. Love it.
author: Alexis D.

description:
I'm going to start by saying I'm not a big pastry fan. But my wife and I were walking by and she wanted a pastry. We bought a few different items. ALL amazing. 
This is a true gem in a city filled with options.
author: Adam P.

description:
We stopped in to one of our favorite bakeries for a sweet treat and, as expected, were not disapointed. Always nice people, always great dessert, always a great place to sit, relax, people watch.

(I do wish they had soy milk, though.)
author: Veg V.

description: Me and my family ordered the cannoli, the green cake, the chocolate flaky top cake, two raspberry heart cookies, and the minty chocolate cake. Every single thing I bit into I was like.............where the HECK is the flavor?? Tastes like something you buy at Wegmans. Definitely would not recommend. The service was really good! The pastries were really average.
author: Sophia B.

description: I always want to visit this place when I am in the Little Italy area. I like their cakes and cookies very much!
author: Pat S.

description: Made a quick stop here before heading to the airport. We grabbed two cheese and ham croissants and tea for breakfast. Super cute decent sized bakery on the corner with seating inside and some outside.
author: Karolina T.

description: This is an awesome Italian bakery! It's been around since 1914! They have all sorts of pastries and cookies, and everything I tried has been great! The tiramisu and canolis are great. Glad to see this place still going strong after 100 years!
author: Peter K.

description: Found this place walking back to the hotel...the amaretti cookies without the pine nuts are fantastic. They are chewy and crunchy. The other cookies were ok but the amaretti were my favorite. I literally ate a pound of them while I was in SF.
author: Rebecca A.

description: Another beautiful Sunday morning here in North Beach. Apple pastry, al fresco seating, courteous service. Good times...
author: Jeff K.

description:
This place is sooo yummy and OG. Right in teh heart of North Beach Little Italy I stopped by on Fathers day for some sweets and they were amazing. The cannolis and cream puffs are so fresh and sweet. Probably the best cannoli I have ever had. Knocking a star for the price ($4.75 each).... they dont even cost that much in NYC or Boston! 

I really want to try their princess cake... it looks so yummy and is sold by the slice!

Very casual and unpretentious.... great place to grab a coffee and a cookie while site seeing in the area. Right next to a cute park you can go eat at!
author: Erica D.

description: I've been wanting to try Princess cake but it's pretty hard to find. The princess cake here is delicious and it was fun to try! They have a nice selection of pastries (all of which look pretty good). Cake was a bit pricy ($5.75 per slice) but worth a try for sure. Good dessert stop in North Beach/Little Italy!
author: Kalena H.

description: I did not like my bland fudge cake and I asked to exchange it for the cake that was being featured as the sample cake. The counter help refused; said that she'd have to charge me. I'd spent $20.00 and had left a tip. Not great customer service. I definitely won't return to this place. There are many wonderful shops in the area and I regret wasting my time and money here. The second shelf of cookies in the bakery case was full of flies. Neither women that were the counter employees were friendly or entirely helpful. They seemed as if they were bothered to be working or helping customers. Maybe this was just a bad day for them.
author: Carla W.

description:
Stopped into Victoria Pastry for an afternoon pick-me-up. My boyfriend and I ordered an iced coffee and a cannoli. I had been craving a cannoli all day after walking around North Beach and was completely wowed by how amazing their pastries are!

If you are in the North Beach area, definitely check out Victoria Pastry! Can't wait to come back on my next visit!
author: Rebecca D.

description: The desserts are fairly good. This coffee shop is close to where I live. What bothers me is the staff. They don't bother to clean up the mess on the floor like napkins that are all over the place, unkempt tables, windows, overflowing trash bin, etc. This happens around noon and  at the end of the day as well. Well, may I suggest that the owners come here at random to inspect the place. It's a pig sty. Seems to me that workers are just trained to serve and deal with payments. Nothing more. How is this so? I always end up cleaning up the table I have each time I am here. The Mexican helpers (though sweet and really nice) tend to speak soooo loud with each other in Spanish (which can be annoying when people do come here primarily to eat, and then, to take some time for some relaxation).  Honestly, it is so different here as compared to Stella Pastry, its sister company. Same owners, yet the shops have varying cultures, ethical values and customer service. They could have done better  on the former. Just my ten cents.
author: Pizzicatto C.

description:
- Hankering for some pastries from Victoria as I haven't been down in this part of the city in a while 

- Pastries (cakes, cookies) are of good selection

- Price: tad on the costly side- but what place in the city isn't

- People around this area: can't tell if they are locals or tourists, but talk about lack of common sense (ie where to stand in line; how to pay).  Holy sh*t- are we stuck on stupid 

- Worth coming: not so unless you wish to be in the midst of people who lacks common sense and mannerism.  Have fun!
author: Jennifer K.

description: I went there for Thor cannolis and it was very good. I saw some food critics review and decided to go there. It was out of my way but well worth it
author: Bondr M.

description:
I love me a good cannoli. This cute corner Italian bakery sure serves up some pretty good ones. As they should, because they've been around for 100+ years. 
The last time I was here, we just got a cannoli and an eclair after a hefty meal at Mama's. The fried pastry shell was crunchy with a few small air pockets. The sweet cream filling was amazing. The chocolate chips embedded in the ricotta filling was a lovely surprise I was not expecting. 
The eclair was delightful as well. I'd love to come back and try some of their own options, too.
author: Joy W.

description:
Slipped in here today 6/1/16 just in time before closing. 

Three years ago they moved to this location and was the first time I've been in... been going to their sister store Stellas instead.

I might be biased as I grew up with these desserts as a kid. The neighbor across the street, an original SF native always brought them in. She always used to say, "you haven't lived until you've tried their princess cake!!" 

I think most might find their princess cake too sweet especially if your not into marzipan - almond paste, from what I've noticed lots of American born people are not that into it.

Go in for their cookies sold by the pound. They are outstanding esp the pine nut cookies. I bought a variety of cookies and a Napoleon. All good stuff. At 8pm I could tell that the Napoleon was a bit soggy from sitting likely 12 hours but still as good as this type of dessert gets. See photos. At Stellas I know they sell cannolis and typically they only have a couple filled on display. As the day goes along they fill more to prevent soggyness. Didn't see any cannolis today at Victorias. In fact the two Napoeons they had left were sort of hidden toward the back. 

Would be nice if they would sell smaller slices. Typically what is sold here is rich. I recommend buying a slice and sharing with a friend along with a few pine nut cookies each.

Try also in SF Tartine and BPatasserie. In Alameda try Crispian for the best almond croissant youve ever had.
author: Stefan T.

description: The pastry is great but the experience isn't pleasant, front door is broken and stands open, cold breeze blows in trash, the floors are filthy, tables not cleaned, music so loud you can't think. Sit outside? Forget it, no one has washed the sidewalk in ages.  Get it to go and RUN.
author: Paul W.

description:
Very good Swedish cake. A bit sweet, but good. The tiramisu wasn't sweet at all. Is this how it should be? 

Kinda want sweet tiramisu now.
author: Leica G.

description: Excellent desserts and friendly customer service. I suggest the almond torte and amaretti. Hot chocolate was good, too. There are a few tables inside and outside for people watching and enjoying coffee and dessert.
author: Carol W.

description:
I ordered a princess cake. The staff was friendly but couldn't remember if I paid because whoever took my call didn't make note of it. 

The cake was yummy!  But it wasn't a technically sound princess cake. Princess cakes have a dome of whipped cream and even sponge cake layers inside. Good but not exceptional.
author: Haana R.

description:
Small place with an open pastry kitchen that gives it character. Great for a hot chocolate and cake. I had the carrot cake and really enjoyed it. I was sat next to an adorable old lady that apparently comes there every Sunday after church. 

The place is right on Washington square and very close to Pier 39 (10-15min walk). 

I didn't try the cannoli but as a Sicilian I loved to see some there!
author: Lucas G.

description:
Tiramisu ~ try their Tiramisu cake! I had a lot of love with their Tiramisu cake especially with coffee in the afternoon! It tastes so spongey and the flavors are just right! But it's so pricey.. 

Overall, I'm a keeper of Victoria's Pastry!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: So good that we went back a second time to get cookies to bring back to TX.  Extremely fresh and tasty - better then cookies we get in some of the East Coast Italian places...perfect with a cup of coffee.
author: Joel B.

description: Our go to place for Italian pastries!!! We love their cheesecake, custard pilled pastry, Italian wedding cookies, Biscottis and their great coffees. If you are in Washington square it's a good place to stop.
author: Summer B.

description:
Lovely afternoon spot with classic Italian desserts. Perhaps one of my favorite parts of this is that it was previously located a few blocks away next to my grandfather's butcher shop and it doesn't seem like a lot has changed. 

I had the panna cota and it was smooth, rich, but light. Lovely flavor with some bright fruit to finish it off. An item like this or a slice of cake is about $5.50. There are four or five tables as well for people to catch up over coffee and cake.
author: Tracy S.

description: Everything is delicious here. No bad options in sight!  I've been loving this place since childhood.
author: Amy H.

description: I stopped by today with my family and we were so happy and satisfied with what we ordered. We got a slice of strawberry shortcake it was so good! Super moist and the cream was perfect. My daughter got some little sprinkle cookies and she loved them so much. There are lots of cake slices and whole cakes for sale along with lots of different types of cookies and pastries. I wish I could have tried everythingThe customer service is also great. The next time I come to San Francisco I will be back. Might stop by before we go home. Thank you Victoria Pastry Co. you guys are great
author: R A.

description:
Ummm this place takes the trophy for the best tasting Pastries I've ever tried and I've tried alot !!

Tried this place for the furst time on the 29th and then again today on the 31st beforevisuting the Coit tower .

I had a strawberry cream sponge slice and a red velvet cupcake with cream the first day and the 2nd day a absolutely amazing custard and soft strawberry jam danish and another strawberry cream sponge slice.. i was making slight moaning noises while eating these amazing pastries.. i was in my own world lol !!

A must go if you love tasty cream and delicous sponge pastries and they got some tasty cookies amd coffees and hot chocolates too !! 

Might have to go back here 1 more time before i leave on the 2nd haha !!
author: Billy E.

description: Very very good and very tasty.  Pastries are so fresh and tasty.  They have LavAzza coffee an Italian fresh brewed coffee.
author: Erwin G.

description:
Two words: Princess cake! 

If there is one thing you want to get, I'd recommend that. It is super moist and shareable. After having one bite, I knew I had to come back one day. I shared it with a friend, and half the slice was more than enough to satisfy my sweet tooth.

Before leaving,I bought a bag of cookies to go and they were good. Next time I would want to try the cannoli.

Overall, great service. The woman helping me was very patient and helpful when I was making my pastry selections. I'd definitely come back!
author: Corinna T.

description: This place is amazing! It's a bit on the pricier side, but totally worth it! I have tried several different desserts and they are all really good.
author: Samantha C.

description: Outstanding cannoli and tiramisu. Staff friendly and service is very quick for a busy location. Reminded me of Italian bakeries in NYC! Wish I could get monthly cannoli shipped to my house.
author: Tracy M.

description:
1:30pm on a Sunday afternoon and your waiting in line with Hubby and a Girlfriend at Mama's after dragging them to the Escape from Alcatraz Triathlon when the talk turns to Chocolate Pastries for later. What do you do? Yelp, of course! Luckily Victoria Pastry was literally just around the corner so I was able to go and see what the offerings were while I left my Husband in Line.

The place is on the small side and the Lady working not in the least bit cheery or welcoming, the cases were absolutely filled with row's of Cookies, Cupcakes, Pastries and Cake slices of which I settled on a Chocolate Eclair for my Husband and a slice of Princess Cake for myself. I was pleased to discover that they have both the cream and custard filled Eclairs available here.

The Princess Cake was ok, a little lacking in the jam layer but with a good Almond flavor, My Husband somewhat enjoyed the Eclair, it was a little on the dry side so I'm not sure how long it was kept in the case. I would be interested in returning at Easter as I see they Bake Hot Cross Buns here.
author: Emmalouise B.

description:
Aside from the fact that San Franciscans are strong supporters of a family business, there's a reason why this bakery has been around since 1914: their Swedish Princess cake.

Soft layers of sponge cake with raspberry jam and whipped cream covered with sweet marzipan fondant that tastes fresh, never crumbly. They've perfected the art of making this cake that even the Swedes will approve of. An 8 inch will set you back $35, but that's a memorable cake the birthday girl won't soon forget. 

Other enticing italian baked goods line the display case, but I wanted a sampling of the humongous strawberry cream puff. Ask for it if it's freshly made and you won't be disappointed. 

I personally have been going to Schubert's bakery for better cake selection (at a cheaper price) but Victoria's Pastry Company wins the Swedish Princess cake test by a mile.
author: Janice C.

description: We were walking through SF and noticed a lot of people inside the shop and people going into the bakery. We decided this must be a good place and stopped to have coffee, a kanole, and almond cookies. OMG, these are the freshest and most delicious pastries I've had in a long time. When we're venturing in SF we will definitely come by again to taste more of their deliciousness
author: Newonda N.

description:
I've been going to Victoria Pastry for over 20 years.  I have rarely been disappointed with their mille feuille and, unfortunately, yesterday was one of those occasions.

The crème pâtissière tasted like it was out of a can and it was lemony instead of the rich custard that they used to use.  The pâte feuilletée was somewhat soggy indicating to me that the Napoleon had been sitting in the display case for a while.  However, the fondant was fine.

To be fair, it may have been just an off day or a new pastry chef.  I'll be back again to give it another try since I've been a VP fan for very long time!
author: Bill N.

description: OMG! LOVE the Princess Cake!!! read the reviews and it did not disappoint!!! the cake was perfectly moist, the raspberry jam add a hint of sweetness along with the whipped cream, and the almond marzipan icing was amazing!!! YUMMM... now i need to find it in NYC. Giving it 4 stars because the box for the cake was way too big and my cake was messy when I made it back to the hotel (only a few blocks and i was being careful).
author: Jenny Z.

description: Overpriced food that is nothing special, very bland. Two eclair for $12. Highly disappointed.
author: Tom G.

description: They have the most amazing pastries ever! The napoleon are to die for and our son was drooling over his cinnamon roll. It's a tight squeeze for seating but other then that this place is incredible!!
author: Amber A.

description: Right across the street from Washington Square Park, they have a huge counter of little cookies, cakes, eclairs, cannolis, etc. SO cute! Also have coffee/espresso.
author: Natalie M.

description:
This is one of my favorite local coffee and pastry shops in North Beach. They used be in another location nearby, but they definitely aced it with this one! It is  diagonally across the street from Washington Square Park and on the edge of Little Italy. 

The pastry is good, but be aware that their croissants go fast, so get there early!

They get their coffee beans from Graffeo, which is another San Francisco original, right around the corner.
author: Afshin A.

description:
We happened upon this gem while strolling through North Beach.  The only complaint I have is that I was stuffed from lunch .

So we shared a Tiramasu which was great.  Everyone working here was friendly and interacted a lot with the customers.  

Apparently we looked very happy while enjoying our snack as several customers stopped to ask what we were having.  

Can't wait to go back, I think we'll stop here and just skip dinner.
author: Russ V.

description:
Perhaps I ordered the wrong pastry, but I was a little disappointed by Victoria Pastry Company. 

I had high hopes for the bakery because it's so adorable - a cute little shop on a street corner in Russian Hill. There's little tables outside to enjoy a cappuccino and people watch. 

My fiancé and I shared the Fedora cake (think tiramisu minus the espresso) and it was gorgeous but the taste was not mind blowing. I also ordered a single cappuccino and was glad it was only a single and not a double because it was really tough to get through. It was extremely bitter and the milk tasted a bit burnt. I noticed other tables had also left about half of their espresso drinks behind so they must just use a bitter blend. 

The girls working behind the counter were very friendly and I'd love to come back and give them another chance, but I'd skip the coffee and get a different pastry next time.
author: Jenni L.

description:
This is a small bakery located right off Columbus Avenue. There's a good variety of pastries here. I think their specialty is a princess cake. They sell cakes by the slice.

I tried some princess cake and thought it was good although a tiny bit too sweet for my tastes. The cake is soaked in some sort of syrup.

I got a cannoli myself. It was quite good with lots of chocolate chips in the cream.
author: Danielle C.

description:
A convenient North Beach location with a pretty good variety of sweet treats. We were lured in by the colorful cupcake artwork outside...

Once I stepped inside I was a bit bummed to see the cupcakes had a low frosting-to-cake ratio. As a frosting fiend, I knew by sight these would not be my favorites... but the cupcakes we tried were better than expected. The red velvet had a surprisingly nice cocoa/coffee flavor, which brought me back to the Italian bakeries my grandmother visited with me as a kid. I liked that there was some frosting piped inside the cake, but I still could have done with a bit more on top. 

There is seating inside but it feels a bit bare, and a little too busy. It's not the kind of place you cozy up and hang with your afternoon delight... but it might be the kind of place you stop by and grab something to take home. Plus, that would give you time for the refrigerated goodness to get up to room temperature.
author: Catie F.

description: We were dining next door and having heard about all the rave reviews on the princess cake we stopped by to taste and something was off in the marzipan , the rest of the cake was fine but I was getting an off taste of stale/ rancid  oil or fat in the marzipan that we had to leave it out. So much for all the raving
author: Prathima K.

description: We decided to stop here before our trip back home from SF. The tiramisu had just come out of the kitchen so we ordered that. It was very good. I ordered just a regular latte and that was good as well. The interior space is quite small but there is a park across the street where we enjoyed our dessert.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Came by bright and early to pickup some of the princess cake for my wife's birthday. The people were very nice. The smell inside was so good and welcoming. The cake was delicious and a big hit with the family. Thank you guys for making my wife's birthday special!
author: Eddie H.

description:
HOLY MOLY CANNOLI

Finally had the chance to check out this pastry shop that has been around since 1914! I read the reviews about the Princess Cake but it honestly did not look appealing to me. Granted, I do have bad luck with choosing the good looking ones with an unappealing taste. Anywho! I ended up having the Almond Tarte (flaky pastry, almond butter cake and raspberry) and the Cannoli (ricoota and chocolate chips). 

First off, the Almond Tarte was meh. It was chewy and borderline solid. It was too difficult to attack with my fork, although I may be misinterpreting the "tarte" as a cake? Either way, I didn't taste the almond and the raspberry had a peanut butter-ish texture that I was not a fan of.

But the CANNOLI. Oh man! It's basically a thick crusted, flaky pastry wrapped around a long tube of cream. When you bite into it, the thick crust just cracks the entire cannoli into pieces but the combination of the crust and the cream made me want to take another bite! It was delicious!

I honestly do feel like the pastries are a little overpriced for what it is, but it's a type of pastry I've never had and Victoria's might have started a new addiction. I swear I'll try the Princess Cake next time to see what the hubbub is all about!
author: Linda K.

description: The cannoli and cappuccino are a crowd pleaser and will surely make your day start off right!
author: Aviva F.

description:
I was on a princess cake hunt throughout the city after having it at my wedding and landed here. Unfortunately, their princess cake did not compare to the one we had in Novato, which did definitely set a very high standard, but still - I was hoping for more.

The plus was that they had really friendly service.
author: Emily H.

description:
Nice little Italian coffee shop in north beach

With a great location (next to the park), outdoor seating, and waitstaff dressed like they are from diners in the mad men era, this little coffee shop definitely reminds you of what coffee shops looked like back in the day. The coffee is average, and so is the italian soda that I recently ordered--in general food quality is as expected.

Would probably stop by once in a while if I happen to be in the area, but probably not a place to make a detour just to visit.
author: Henry L.

description: We live less than a block away and ordered the Strawberry Shortcake a few days in advance for a dinner party. So glad we did. Everyone that it was absolutely amazing. Really fresh strawberries.
author: Timothy H.

description:
Excellent iced latte!! Better than other cafes in the area and cheaper than Caffe Greco which comes in at $5. The pastries are hit or miss but not so expensive. Although they use a gross raspberry filling that looks like it came out of a can for their danishes. Also the custard on the danish looks "gummy and gelatinous". I don't think I would buy it again. I think I'll go for the cream cheese and blueberry danish with slits on top. At least the blueberry filling is hidden if it came out of a can. The almond tart is gross. Tastes like too much artificial almond flavoring went in and couldn't taste the raspberry jam layer. Also super dry. The chocolate chip cookie is solid (but not Specialty's quality). 

This place is a go-to in the area for me.
author: Catherine L.

description:
Recommended by a local tour guide.

Verdict:

   Princess Slice -- 4/5; appealingly pretty, perfect amount of sweetness, but very faint (almost non existent) aroma of triple sec.

   Cheese cake -- 3/5; a bit heavy and one-dimensional.

   Double latte -- 5/5; high quality coffee, much better tasting than a Starbucks latte, and the barista also drew a perfectly shaped heart on its surface.
author: Trong D.

description: I grew up eating treats from Victoria's.  Any time we visited the city from San Jose, we made it one of our last stops so we had cookies to eat on our way home.  I came in with my daughter and bought a cannoli and some cookies.  The cookies were fine, but the cannoli??? Horrible! I am a big fat Italian American dude who has eaten cannoli his whole life.  I don't know who Victoria's is trying to fool, but these were NOT cannoli! No flavor at all and way too expensive.  I will come back for the cookies and for the convenience as it is close to SS Peter and Paul, but skip the cannoli.
author: Lamia O.

description: Stopped in for a slice of cake a few days ago and decided on the beautiful green princess cake. The staff were so sweet and helpful. The cake itself was so delicious. Not overly sweet but definitely satisfying and tasty. Will definitely be stopping by here to try more treats!
author: Jessica G.

description: My mom got a princess cake from this bakery for my baby shower, and WOW was it amazing. Best cake I've ever tasted, and absolutely gorgeous too. The marzipan top is genius because it looks so nice & smooth like a fondant but tastes much better. The inside of the cake is light and fluffy with delicious layers of whipped cream. I would highly recommend one of these for any upcoming cake-eating occasion!
author: Emily A.

description:
What do you need to know about Victoria Pastry?  First, the yelp address states it's in Russian Hill, but it's not.  It's overlooking Washington Square Park, which is definitely North Beach.  

Now, what this bakery excels at...

The Princess Cake.  Tried it for the first time here when I was 20 or 21 & have kept it in my life ever since.  I'm way over 21 now.

The Cappuccino Cake.  I've gotten one for more than a couple of birthday cakes.  Coffee & cream, in a cake?  Heavenly.

The little "gingerbread" raisin cookies.  In Italian, they're known as papassinos.  Soft & chewy, they're diamond/rectangular shaped & addictive.  Really, with milk, coffee, a cappuccino, or a latte...a perfect marriage.

I've heard some complain that Victoria Cakes are too expensive.  I disagree.  They are worth it.  And, you get what you pay for.

They are known for their eclairs & cream puffs as well; but I rarely order those.  I love cake.  And those cookies.  

Sometimes I miss their original location (corner of Stockton & Vallejo), but admittedly that's only if I'm headed to the Walgreens a couple doors down from there.  This Washington Square Park location is far superior, only smaller.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: This place has THE BEST cannoli's we have ever had. And my husband is Italian so that says a lot. We went back to the next day just to get more! Everything else looked super good too.
author: Cassandra P.

description:
Boom. Princess cake. The end. 

Yet another princess cake review but I couldn't resist. It's the best slice of non chocolate cake I've ever had! Worth every penny. Perfectly textured yellow cake with layers of whipped cream, custard, raspberry and triple sec all blanketed in a beautifully textured marzipan! 
Every bite is perfectly balanced with just the right amount of cake and filling. What an amazing flavor profile! How have I never heard of princess cake before!!! 

This slice of glory will make even the mightiest of macho men feel like a princess. 

As for the rest of VPC's pastries, they all look gorgeous and mouth watering and I'm sure they will have something to satisfy whatever your sweet tooth desires.
author: Jess K.

description: Everything looked so good when I walked in, I couldn't decide what I wanted.  So I went with a slice of tiramisu, black and white, and the strawberry shortcake and ate them over 3 days.  All were deliciously fresh, with the black and white being my new favorite!  Yummy!
author: Kimberly W.

description: Excellent cheesecake!! Reasonably priced and a good location, this little bakery was a nice stop for any day in Washington Square park. Try the wedding cookies! We will certainly come back again in the future.
author: Jacob W.

description:
Meandering my way around the hood, trying to kill some time before a cheese class, when I find myself walking right by Victoria Pastry Company......fate was telling me it was *finally* time to give their Princess Cake a try.....it's been haunting me for forever!

And since everybody needs a friend, got a slice of Princess Cake as well as St. Honoré Cake to do the ultimate taste test

Princess Cake - very sweet & light as air - loved the almond undertones to the cake & the raspberry jam was a nice cutting contrast.  The fork sliced its way through this cake like nobody's business & I found 1 slice could have served 2 people due to high sugar-sweetness factor.  Would get it again & pair w/ a lovely espresso.  I imagine the bitter coffee would be a perfect pairing!

St. Honoré Cake - put a cream puff on anything & I'm going to be a fan & this was no exception.  I liked the almond flavor to the cake & the whipped cream layers.  The bottom layer was like pastry dough & was kind of difficult to cut w/ the plastic fork - ended up getting whipped cream & cakey layers all over my little plate.... until I brought a knife into the picture.  Then it was much more manageable - but this still wouldn't stop me from getting it again - yeah, it was *that* good

So for my 1st foray into the world of Italian cakes in North Beach, have to say I'm a huge fan!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Funny that I've lived here over twenty years and went here for the first time only today! From now on, Victoria's! Everything looked delicious, but I had to have the cannoli. Top notch! Very consistent filling and excellent shell. I also tried a pignolia amaretti, which I got to go. I stood outside eating it and almost cried when a little bit fell on the ground. Oh well, that's the way the cookie crumbles.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description:
Solid pastry and bakery café with a pretty authentic selection of Italian desserts. 

Perfect location in North Beach for a coffee and a pastry break.
author: Eric B.

description: Old-school and absolutely delicious... Great service. Cannoli out of this world, Napoleon too!  Princess cake almond cake... Italian macaroons... Delicious
author: Lindsay H.

description:
Ruined my birthday party. Not fresh. Called to order a small strawberry shortcake they told me they only take orders for bigger parties of 10-15 ppl. So I went in to buy the individual portions, $5.40 each. They put fresh strawberries on top but inside the strawberries were not fresh and brownish in color. Was embarrassed in front of my guests. My guests recommended I order from Whole Foods next time,fresh, any size and same day orders.

My first negative review on yelp:( very upset.
author: C-R-I-S-T-I-N-A C.

description:
Walked by this place on my way to dinner and the sign on the door said they were open until 8:00 p.m.  Went to dinner and came back here for dessert.  It was 7:00 p.m. and they were closed.

Not cool.  Either stay open until your posted closing time or update your sign!

I don't like missing dessert!!!!
author: Bay G.

description: Enjoyed a latte and tiramisu. My daughter had cookies & got chocolate. Was a little disappointed that they were out of cannolis. Over great pastries & people watching.
author: Amy S.

description:
I've always liked their Chocolate Eclairs and Princess Cake!

You can taste that their Chocolate Eclairs are made fresh instead of having the taste texture of just being in refrigeration for hours!

As for their Princess Cake, I have always thought this cake looked unique ever since growing up because it has a chewy green outer layer and a layer of raspberry jam packed inside!  It also reminds me of a cake that you would see in Alice in Wonderland, Mad Hatter's Tea Party!  It is very toot sweet!

They also offer other sweet, baked goodies here, but those two delights are my main favorites at this pastry shop!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Came by for a cannoli after lunch one day and it was $4.75 for one  tiny cannoli! In my head I was thinking that it's better be this magical ethereal cannoli and it was! The cream was thick but not too sweet, the pastry was fresh, but it was gone a little too fast.
author: Linda H.

description: Princess cake slice and coffee proved to be exactly what I expected, beautifully done - and coffee from carafe was still fresh. Old old bakery still doing it well.
author: cm g.

description:
Each pastry and dessert outdid the next. This cute shop has a great selection and all the cakes/cookies taste fresh! 
We tried their chocolate cake and our eyes rolled back in our heads. Cookies are amazing too
My only regret was that my mouth is not big enough to consume the entire display case! 
Probably one of the best bakeries in the area.
author: Neesh Q.

description:
I live in the south bay and I would drive up the peninsula just to get the St. Honroe Cake. I have not yet to try anything else but I am sure it's just as amazing. I just remember 13 years ago while in college I was going to CCSF, and I had tried this cake and I fell in love with the cake. It is so yumy, I swear you will love it too. It has layers of flakey crust, taste like taramisu in between with custard, but I could be wrong and these creme puff's on top It has a lilttl bit a chocolate and it is just amazing. I love sweets and sugar, but for a cake not that sweet, I love it. I drive up here every year to get Andy's birthday cake. I think it's worth the drive. Now that they have this new location, you can find parking a whole lot easier than 13 years ago. When you place an order, you have to pay on the spot fyi. which I think is great becasue when you come and pick up your cake, you can just get it and go. The storefront looks so much better than their old location, where you can see through the windows and they eve have outdoor seating, if you want to enjoy your desert. They sell the cake by sllices or whole. PLus there is a park near by across the street, but soe desert and walk the park. 

I take that back, they have this pricess cake if I recall, that cake was amazing too. It's a small and dainty cake but it's good. Noy like the St. Honroe cake, where you can buy it round or full sheets. Best cake ever!!!
author: An N.

description:
1914? That's how long Victoria Pastry has been selling its delicious sweet delicacies.  Victoria relocated to the corner of Filbert and Powell streets after moving from its long-time location at the corner of Vallejo and Stockton streets.  

This new location is smaller and it appears that the menu selection has decreased as well. They still have the Italian cookies, larger cookies, danishes, cannolis, slices of cakes and whole cakes. Came here to buy slices of my "go-to's", the Princess cake and St, Honore.  Had to settle with the Princess cakes slices since it appears that they don't sell the St. Honore anymore, as it's not even listed on their menu board. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/victoria-pastry-company-san-francisco-2?select=mSu3uywafqw7HHNCI11Ysg#7bdx2vdFPVhcAVXNe5abdQ)

If you haven't tried it, Princess cake is a yellow cake with layers of whipped cream, custard, raspberry jam, triple sec and covered with a smooth layer marzipan. A princess indeed. The Princess cake was as delicious as usual and wished I had some St. Honore to try as well. Victoria, please bring back the St. Honore.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/victoria-pastry-company-san-francisco-2?select=mSu3uywafqw7HHNCI11Ysg#LBtTA8QoY__6GmXLd2d3Jw)
author: Al L.

description: Nice place for dessert in the North Beach area.  We had the Princess cake and the Napoleon, they were both delicious.  Wish we would have had to come back to try more of the amazing desserts that they offer. Nice inside and outside seating areas to enjoy your dessert and coffee and people watch.
author: Marcia M.

description: so glad we stumbled upon this spot!  we were walking around north beach and looking for pizza (per usual) and voila! - there it was on the corner.  i dont typically roam around that area, so i knew we had to stop in.  we tried a slice of the princess cake and the chocolate truffle cake - both were good.  the fondant on the princess cake was not overly sweet and really good texture, while the chocolate was so dense and rich - just how i like them! lol we also got a couple small cookies - $12+ pretty good deal!  i would definitely consider buying a princess cake for a dinner party!
author: Christina L.

description: What can I say this place omg so good and I love pastries! This was just fabulous! I had the black and white cake soo good ... can't wait to go back !
author: michelle r.

description: Not impressed with the cannoli.......at all.  Also bought cannoli at Stella's, and they looked EXACTLY the same as Victoria's!!!!  Not worth buying
author: Susan M.

description: Princess Cake!!!!!!!!! Didn't think I would like this cake but it's now one of my favorites! I have yet to try their Canolis!
author: Cheryl V.

description: Got the princess cake because of all the rave reviews. Unfortunately it just wasn't the type of cake I would like. Way way way too sweet. Though the sponge was moist and soft. The bakery looked nice and maybe I will try some other ones.
author: Jenn May Z.

description: The desserts are so good. Best German Chocolate Cookie - so many choices- the problem is which one should I choose when I want them all!!!
author: Olga M.

description:
Princess Cake. It's the biggest reason to stop in at Victoria Pastry Company.

My first stop-in was with a Yelp friend, and we'd settled on a couple of other choices, considering the high-gear of our sweet tooth at that moment. However, when we sat down to enjoy our eats, we noticed a couple sitting next to us with just the Princess Cake. The woman of the couple began to strike up a conversation with us... about Princess Cake.

She is addicted to Princess Cake - considers herself a connoisseur of Princess Cake. She says that everyone usually goes to this one other bakery for Princess Cake, but she's found that Victoria Pastry Company has THE BEST. She would know. She has to have Princess Cake if she ever sees it anywhere. When she discovered neither of us have had it, she refused to let that continue to be the case and lopped off a piece of her cake and gave it to us to try out.

Hello, Princess Cake! Where have you been in my life?!

Cake has always been a member of the "It does the job and generally all right" club, but Princess Cake gets special honors. The textures, the flavors, especially the texture of the marzipan puts this slice of heaven above the clouds.

I did return during my trip for a slice of my very own and to try other things. While the other pastries are quite nice, Princess Cake is the business.

I think the only drawback is that their offerings of tea are Bigelow (yuck!) and their offerings of coffee typically taste burned.  There is nothing like a good cup of tea with your pastry, but you're not going to find that good cuppa here.

Princess Cake. Done.
author: Cate T.

description: You should try the Red Velvet cupcakes, they are from an other world. The cheesecake is pretty good too
author: Håvard E.

description:
Mmm cannoli was delish, coffee was on point! 

Wish they had a few more savory pastry items to enjoy for breakfast - but I can't complain as every item I have tasted has been great.
author: Laura R.

description: Our family has been going to Victoria's Pastry for as long as I can remember (more than 30 years).  It used to be on Stockton St and the cakes were the best in North Beach.  However,  since it  moved to Filbert St. I feel something has changed.  We took home their rum cake and it was not the same as we remembered it from before.  The quality of the cake had gone down.  First, the outer layer used to be all whipping cream.  Now the sides are partially covered with buttercream or some kind of icing.  It's okay if you like the buttercream taste but to us, it tasted artificial.  Second, the bottom of the cake used to be drenched with rum and you could certainly taste it.  Now, there was no rum taste at all.  For the amount of money they are charging for cakes these days, there are better places to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: J L.

description:
Love this place. The desserts on display are simply mouth watering.

We shared a slice of the Fedora cake,which was chocolate on more chocolate, along with two lattes. Cake could be a little more moist, but the icing was divine-creamy but wonderfully dense. There was also subtle hints of orange zest which I love. The lattes were okay-not too strong but still good.

Location is pretty good. The park across the street isn't the newest, but my friend's 2 year old still enjoys its playground plenty. There's about 4 2 seater tables right out front which is great for people watching, but there are a lot of cars driving by because its a busy intersection. There isn't much seating inside.

Overall it's just such a cute place with a fantastic selection of quality delectables that it's hard not to love.
author: Daffodil L.

description: Whenever I'm in North Beach area for dinner, I usually get my dessert fix with their powdered strawberry filled shortbread cookies. They are dangerously good. I also enjoy the friendliness of their staff usually a couple of younger kids.
author: Kristine A.

description: Pretty standard bakery and coffee house. Good, attentive service. I come here often as it is a convenient location and contains no hipsters or laptoppers.
author: Sam S.

description:
This bakery cafe used to be a 5 star, but since the move a few years back, the quality and attention to detail are lacking.  The"new" location doesn't have the "old Italian" feel, and is sadly, loud  and looking rather run down.
Prices are up there, and necessary for the work and expense in making a good pastry, but because of this, the bakery isn't too fast to rotate out the old product.  If I'm paying over $7 for a pastry and coffee, I expect the best quality product available, not a soggy day old piece of cake.  
I'll always have good memories of the place, but they won't be of the bakery it is now.
author: Linda T.

description:
I'm afraid I'm biased and I just love this bakery. This is the bakery that my husband's family has been buying Italian Rum Cake at for years and they also made our wedding cake which had layers of Italian Rum Cake and Princess Cake (almond flavor). For my husband's birthday party this year I hiked from downtown San Francisco to Victoria Pastry Company on foot just to retrieve an Italian Rum Cake for him. I really love Victoria Pastry Company.

The cakes here are always light, flavorful and moist which was not the case when we did cake tasting sessions for our wedding. A lot of the cakes we tasted were on the dry and heavy side,  so it was nice to know that we could have our wedding cake made here and didn't have to settle for something else. 

Whenever we buy a cake to share I notice that people help themselves to seconds, especially when it comes to the Italian Rum Cake. It makes you feel like you had a shot of rum, which I enjoy but others might not. In that case I would recommend the Princess Cake.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Tiramisu--so good! Well balance of flavors and super moist. 
Cheesecake---delicious cheesecake. It was not overly sweet and the crust was perfect. My favorite dessert of the three. 
Cannoli--I liked the cream inside the cannoli but I felt the shell could use some work. I'm not a cannoli expert but I've tasted a few to know this was not the best. 

Each piece of dessert was around $3-$4 and it fed a group of 4 for Thanksgiving. They were the perfect size. The staff here is friendly and the atmosphere is charming which I love ! Highly recommend this place.
author: Samantha S.

description:
You know how most places that have any "gluten friendly" options are absolute shit?


There are a few almond cookies that have no gluten Ingredients that are insanely good!

They're small little cookies, and insanely good!
author: Christopher C.

description:
Walking along the street before dinner, my husband and I got excited when we saw this place. It looked like it would serve legit cannolis. They only had chocolate chip ones left, not a traditional flavor but we were psyched. Ordered two thinking they'd pipe them fresh, as good cannolis are done, she took two pre-filled ones from the counter. Strange. 

What's worse was they cost us $9 for two. Holy Hanna! They better be delicious. Unfortunately, the cannolis were soggy (as expected with pre-filled ones) and the filling left a weird texture in our mouths. So disappointed.
author: Cherie F.

description: This cute little bakery sells Italian cookies by the POUND! Their cannoli's are to die for and the workers are really friendly.
author: Katie P.

description:
For San Francisco standards, Victoria Pasty is a mediocre bakery. As a local of the neighborhood, I only stop by when I really crave for a pastry and I am too lazy to walk 2 more blocks. 

I have tried their eclair (2*), tiramisu (3*), panna cotta (4*) and some other things I don't recall right now. So, I actually gave them several chances and I was disappointed pretty much every time I try something new. The pastries are decent but they taste less than how they look. The people working there are very friendly and that's one of the reasons why I keep coming back.
author: Gokhan T.

description:
My friend suggested that we go here after lunch in SF Little Italy. I decided to get a cannoli, as I LOVE cannoli's. I deem myself the cannoli expert, so this review is based on the cannoli I got, which I would expect a place in SF Little Italy to be quite stellar and nothing less. 

Sadly it was not. The cannoli overall tasted stale, the ricotta cream in the middle was not very smooth and uneventful. The outer pastry wrap was not crisp enough. The chocolate chips tasted cheesy cheap store bought (um, hello, Ghirardelli is nearby?!?).Oh, and overall the cannoli had too much cinnamon in it. In short, it was a total fail.

The other desserts looked good, but after this place having a supbar cannoli, which should be the "staple" of an Italian pastry shop, I am not compelled to go back. There a lot of other pastry shops in that little Italian hood.
author: Sonia A.

description:
Disastrous experience with these people. After numerous calls around SF for a birthday cake for my girl (to be picked up on Saturday), I spoke with Victoria's and opted to go with them because they had positive reviews. So... After 3 calls back & forth with Brian we were all set. My design and message for my cake were planned. They called the night before to confirm, I confirmed (call #4). No one - and I mean no one - told me that I had to pay in advance in order to have the cake artist actually put the design and the message on the cake. So what happened, no design, no message, crappy cake writing by an employee who tried her best but was not trained on writing on cakes. The cake artist was only there for a few minutes Saturday morning. I was in the air en route to SF so I did not get the managers one call on Saturday morning requesting payment. They cancelled the design. The manager Sylvia Raygosa and the employee Brian were not on the same page about this, and honestly, neither one of them cared. Sylvia said I had to pay in advance, but Brian who took the order didn't know and didn't care. He was the worst, he just sat there playing games on his phone when I was in the store. You could tell he is just one of those humans who comes in to collect a pay check and doesn't care about anything other than himself. 

When I arrived in SF I had no other options. It was too late. The chocolate truffle cake was mediocre, good, but certainly not great. In SF you have so many other better options. Don't support these people because they don't support their own customers. That's my opinion.
author: Daniel W.

description: Such moist deserts.  Try the chocolate cake.  Also, the pana cotta hit the spot. It's a cute little place.  Victoria pasty has been around for a long time
author: Charles C.

description: Great Italian pastries - my favorite thing to get here is their Princess Cake - to die for if you like almond.  So light, so airy.  I've tried several of their various cakes/tortes - everything is delicious, and you cannot go wrong.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Rachael S.

description: Really great service!! liked that they had small bites to try. I got the princess cake and it was delicious. Got it to go and it was still upright in the box after the hour drive home.
author: Katie F.

description: While visiting SF- several people told us to check out this bakery! So glad we did! It's such a cute place aesthetically. Inside- the workers were so friendly. We tried Princess Cake, which is one of their best sellers. It was super tasty and unique! We also tasted the cannoli, lemon bars and wedding cookies. Everything was delicious. The prices are also reasonable. Must try!!
author: Lillian Y.

description: Stumbled upon this wonderful bakery after coming out of Sts. Peter and Paul church.  The samples gave us a good indication of how wonderful their selection tasted.  We ordered the cannoli and the carrot cake and we're still talking about how great they tasted hours after our visit.  This will become a must stop on our next visit to SF.
author: Patty H.

description:
I have fond memories of a special birthday with the St. Honore cake and other pastries throughout they years. This is the first time at this location, and I brought a few pastries to take home. The princess cake marzipan was too sweet for me, the chocolate fedora cake didn't have enough rum for my liking. The napoleon was good, but a bit too sweet for my liking. The "butterfly" cookies were OK, but not sweet enough for my liking. 6 of them cost almost $3, which seems a tad expensive.

All in all, each slice was almost $5. I will be back, but much more selective about my cake choices next time.
author: melissa c.

description: I want to like it, but they ran out of their infamous princess cake (at 2pm in the afternoon!!). The two we got (black and white and cannoli) are just NO good. Sweet with no dimension. Both their chocolate and cream don't taste fresh and quite below standard quality.  What a let down.
author: Miss Y.

description: Victoria Bakery's scones are the best ever! I've never been disappointed with any treat that I've bought here. Friendly staff, great selection, and reasonable prices.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
The best bakery in Northern California.  They make many of their confections
 with sponge cake.  Ridiculously good.  Every time we serve a Victoria Pastry cake (on average about 2 x a month now!) we get rave reviews from our guests.  The only downside--but not worth a star demotion--is the parking situation.  If they had a delivery service we'd order twice as many.  But my butt would be twice as big too, so I guess the inconvenience of parking is good self restraint!
author: Ana M.

description: Glad to see they got a new location unfortunately when I walked in to get my coffee and pastry I was ignored by two young ladies didn't get a hello I got to watch them answer their cell phone prepare other drinks and take phone orders oh well one across the street had a great cup of coffee from the carts authentic Italian delicious dark hot dude serving it up
author: Pedro Proz P.

description:
Growing up to have your birthday cake from Victoria was as good as it can get.  I have ordered several birthday cakes and pastries.  This is a new location - smaller and more cozy.  If you have a craving for something yummy and sweet, they do sell them by the slices...and the price point is fair.  
Service is great - love the new location.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Three words. Hot cross buns.  Only for Easter time though. North Beach staple. Part of my childhood.  Memories. Saint Honore cake is the best. They made my wedding cake a million years ago.  I can still taste it. If you are in the neighborhood you must try it.
author: Luci B.

description: Delicious!! Cannoli and chocolate truffle cakes going down smoothly on a wonderful afternoon in SF!! First time here, would come again. Reminds me from of Mike's Pastries in Boston's North End though I still give Mike's the edge...
author: A-S R.

description: Twice a month I drive to SF for my special needs, food and pastries,  couple places in SF I have to go, one of them is Victoria,  service is great , I always call 30 to 40 minutes to make sure they have what I want "the napoleon's " the best in town , I order 4 to 6 pieces and pick up, I order the mini  Oreillete,  croquant, and raspberry stic, it very good with the afternoon  tea or coffee , this is European style , I have been your costumer for at least 17 years  between Chinatown and down there in Filbert street , see you soon
author: Bilal H.

description: Had the cannoli and panna cotta, both were great. Awesome selection of Italian pastries. Found online as one off the best pastry places in SF and it didn't disappoint.
author: Zech F.

description:
Stopped in today for the first time - I wish I'd gone in sooner!  There are a few coffee shops around North Beach, and most of them have pastries, but Victoria is my new favorite.

I ordered a double mocha and the custard "danish."  So delicious.The mocha is light, not bitter and not overly sweet.  The custard was perfect - I'm not really sure how to describe it...it also wasn't too sweet, but was thick and smooth.  There's not a lot of "pastry" to the custard, but it was good (dry though, so if you don't like flaky and dry you may not like).
author: Deb H.

description: SO! GOOD! Princess cake is so hard to come by in Toronto, and Victoria does it so well. It was so good that we went back again! It's a tad bit pricey for a slice - almost $6, but it was well worth it. The Italian cookies were also fantastic - we tried nearly every flavor and enjoyed the pine nut and walnut ones the most. Definitely stop here if you are in San Fran, it's also apparently been around since the early 1900s and definitely had an older and authentic feel to it.
author: Hana M.

description:
Princess cake = marzipan heaven over a divine weightless wonder of cake, cream, custard and jam.  I always though the top layer was fondant (which I'm not a fan of) but it's marzipan rolled out and colored to the color of some fairy princess' ballgown, and super delicious!  If you don't like almond-flavoring...then marzipan is not for you.  

Prices = reasonable.  ($4.25 for the slice of Princess cake)

Service = friendly.

Seating = limited but we got there around 7 p.m. and it wasn't too busy nor packed.  They seem to have a lot of take out patrons.
author: Fannie S.

description: One of the best bakeries in San Francisco I don't come to the city with out making a stop here every! Their tiramisu is the best around and the espresso is always good! Outstanding staff as well!
author: Jennafer F.

description:
3.5 stars actually.

I ordered a cake a week ago & the gentleman that took my order was very helpful. Took down my order, name, phone number & suggested that it would be easier if I paid when I came to pick up the cake rather than giving him my cc information over the phone.

I called back the day before my pick up date just as a confirmation and the girl who answered my call said that although she sees my order, they didn't have plans to fulfil my order because a cake that large needed to be paid for in advance. I then proceeded to tell her that when I initially placed my order, the gentleman recommended that I pay when I came to pick up. She was very understanding about the situation & assured me that they will still go ahead & make my order & it would be ready for pick up for my scheduled date & time. 

Super grateful for that, except for the part about me having to call back & confirm my order. My order was there. She saw it, but also knew it wouldn't be fulfilled because it wasn't prepaid. Someone should have called me back to let me know that I had to prepay for a cake that large & the gentleman who took my order should not have suggested that I pay at pick up.
author: Tabitha W.

description:
My parents got their St. Honore wedding cake from this bakery in 1960. 

It's pretty cool that it's still here. The bakery, I mean, not the cake.

In the years that followed, my dad would make us go into the city and do this thing where someone popped out of the car to run in and get a St. Honore cake while he drove around the block a few times. There is rarely parking anywhere close. 

This is a time honored family tradition that makes the cake taste even better because it was challenging to acquire said item. 

The cake itself? whipped creamy, rummy, goey goodness. Worth it. 

Totally. 

The bakery outlasted my parent's marriage, unfortunately... but that's not the cake's fault. 

Took my husband last time we were down there, and he agreed. 

It's a rockin' bakery.They have other good stuff too. 

We didn't risk a car wreck though, we parked several, ok many, blocks away and walked over.

The cake still tasted delicious.
author: Janet M.

description: We bumped into this place by accident while walking in Little Italy.  We had the Italian cake which had creme and then of course the lovely princess cake that I was curious about.  I never saw this type of cakes, gummy custard creme yum yum and yum.  It is pretty small on the corner. They do have the typical Taramisu and Napoleon cakes that looked great. I wanted the canoli as well too.  Anyways very good, I loved it and would go again.
author: Keven W.

description: Well, that was a delicious custard filled eclair. Fully intended to eat it when I got home, but ate almost the whole thing in the car...how could you resist? Yum yum. Will be back to sample other goodies.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Was looking for princess cake, and Victoria Pastry did not disappoint on that score. Excellent.
Stella Pastry used to be my favorite pastry shop in SF, but now that I've fallen out of love with their sacripantina (which, by the way, you can also pick up at Victoria Pastry - same owners), I prefer Victoria Pastry.

Wish they were open later though.
author: Aris F.

description: One of if not the best cannoli in SF. We always make it a point to come here when we are in town. I highly recommend when ordering your cannoli, ask that they make you a fresh one. If you ask they will, trust me it's worth asking. You will get the crispiest, tastiest cannoli you have ever had.
author: Jason A.

description: A San Francisco staple since 1915. Me and my family have been customers since 1985 at the old location. We love their strawberry shortcake and princess cakes. No other place in the City where we go for them. Ok, this is San Francisco, do not complain about lack of parking, it's tough in this neighborhood.
author: Al G.

description:
