We couldn't make it past a block to Cobbs Comedy Club after we scored parking without being drawn to this bakery. We stood in the relatively short line. We had an hour before their closing time and there were still costumers so thought that was a good sign. We wanted to try a cannoli but they didn't have any left. The guy helping us seemed like he had a long day and was over it, which is fine but service was just passable. 

We settled on a chocolate cake with chocolate shavings and a peanut butter cookie. Both were fine. I liked the cake. Cookie was on the crunchy side and was sweeter than the already sweet cake. Nothing too offensive except the place smelled like a clean bathroom, better than a dirty one but do you really want a bakery to smell like that? No reason to come back.
author: Julia T.

description:
Victoria Pastry Company holds a special place in my family's heart.  My aunt's wedding cake was made by them way back when (the saintorery cake or however you spell it!).

My family would always stop by whenever we were in town, back when they were at their old location, however on one of my adventures into SF, I was broken hearted to find some tawianese bakery in their old location!.  I ended up yelping and thank god I found out they had moved just a few blocks away.  So, with boyfriend in tow, we made the trek to get a slice of saintorery cake, tiramisu, and cookies for the road.

Despite the move, the cake tasted exactly how i remembered.  crispy puff pastry covered with fluffy cake, topped with airy frosting, all topped with a cream puff.  Heaven all in one bight.  So worth the bart ride, then the epic trek through north beach.  A must try if you're in the area.
author: Meg T.

description: Princess slice! Oh my goodness! Soft, delicate, lightly sweet, pleasant in every way... I'm ready to take this princess home and introduce her to mom. If only I had left some on my plate. Devoured and enjoyed every second. Time for Seconds! Mmmm
author: Alfonso T.

description:
Decided to take a rest and have my dilated eyes (from the optometrist around the corner) get use to some regularity at high noon. This is my first time since the move and wondered if they still have the same bakers.  Wanting to update the review, as well as to be able to see properly again, I had slice of the St. Honoree to compare my last hankerings of this delicious dessert (along with my coffee).  I'm looking for a change here. 

Well, disappointment sets in with the same issues I had with the previous tasting a few years ago. Crust was flat, the cream puffs lacked anything special, and overall the experience was bland. Nothing to excite the palate. What happened to the Italian rum, crispy crust and wonderful cake texture?  

Very sad! Please use the original recepies from the DesDefano family.
author: Stefan L.

description:
Victoria Pastry was  emptied of most  pastries, pies noonish sunday. lots of cookies left though. i was greeted many times but i was trying to see what was left so i didn't respond.

finally i asked her what was the most popular? 
"eclairs, cream puffs"  she responded.
i visisualiized the sweetness of the chocolate and  passed. too single dimensional.
not unique enough so i choose -

eats:
-neapolean cake, slice(4.50)
one kind left, saw online about 5 types
separate layers of flaky crusts, custard, cream. flaky
decadent crispness of the layers of crunchiness intermingled with custard, creme.
delish decadance
-cherry turnover(2.5)
buttery crust with cherry filling reminiscent of cherry pies. 3 stars

crumbs:
-service pretty good.
-not much selection.
-would have been disappointed with an eclair...
author: Victor G.

description: My husband went there half an hour ago to get me an iced coffee. Its not on the menu as iced sweet capuccino but it did have a capuccino and it was not the first time he got an iced capuccino from there. When he told the worker there to make it sweet the worker replied " u put sugar yourself" keep in mind we got sweet iced capuccino from there many times before. Anyway my husband didnt say anything but the worst part is when he received the coffee. i was in shock to find out how much coffee he put in the plastic glass. When u pay 3.75 for a coffe u expect a full glass. well thats not what i got and for a sec i thought my husband drunk out of it but when i asked he said "thats what he gave me" . Needless to say he shouldnt have paid for it but for sure we aint coming back. Workers are sooooooo slow.
author: Lne V.

description:
For my 100th review I guess I'd have to give it to Victoria Pastry Company.

Growing up in this neighborhood ....Victoria Pastry Company was always my favorite.  I had my first Chocolate Eclair here and had it many more times after that.....today it's just as tasty as I can remember.

The Eclair is filled with either Whipped Cream or Custard and topped off with a Chocolate Frost.  You have got to bite into this....it's lite, it's tasty.....I don't mind getting whipped cream all over my mouth while eating this....but please do not touch my Eclair.

The St. Honore Cake

This was also one of my favorite cake in my younger days and today it still is.  The St. Honore Cake is a Vanilla pastry cream flaky crust and layered with rum soaked sponge layers and topped off with a ring of vanilla cream puffs.  Should you order a whole cake you can ask for extra cream puffs.  Do not take a slice of St. Honore Cake without the Cream Puff......because they go hand and hand.  Not too sweet, you can taste the Rum a little.  A fun cake to eat!!

The Princess Cake

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxtDQfBA3ECjTUO7CG1YXQ?select=eyhHHmI92CQPLGqPTFaayg

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxtDQfBA3ECjTUO7CG1YXQ?select=CB3aDY11FvUEsB92zuMVXg

3 sections of sponge cake filled with whipped cream, vanilla custard and raspberry filling.  This is topped off with a Marzipan icing (Green, Pink or Natural color).  I brought this cake into work for a celebration and it was gone within 20 minutes.  At our company usually we have lots of cake left over...but not this time.

Next the cookies....Amaretti Plain Cookie and the Amaretti Pinenut (Pignolli) Cookie.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxtDQfBA3ECjTUO7CG1YXQ?select=K3S1QHj1QdLwiWDVSjwaIw

This is a Macaroon almond mix and on the sweet side of thing....this is made with egg whites.  The Pignolli has Pinenuts added to the cookie.  Both cookies are on the rich side but very tasty.

The Torrone

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxtDQfBA3ECjTUO7CG1YXQ?select=qGwUZ-AvFRJNF5sDMhsb2w

Torrone is an Italian candy, very popular in Italy.  They make their own at Victory Pastry.  It's made of Honey, Fresh roasted Hazelnuts and nougat.  Very chew nougat.  The Nougat is sold in blocks....I like to cut up the blocks into small so it's easier to eat.

All this was around for me when I was growing up and today they continue to put a smile on my face.

Special orders be sure to call it in or go online and place your order!

I've not had an item here that has failed me......
They take cash and Credit Cards....
There are a few tables available for having a snack and some coffee.
Enjoy the food, enjoy the fun!!

Rating - 5 stars from ever since I can remember.
Service - 5 stars....very nice people.
Parking can be a challenge in this area.
author: Alan L.

description: I've been coming to Victoria Pastry my entire life for wonderful wonderful pastries and especially love the little cookies. This time I had the cannoli and would really love to try the St Honore's cake some time. There are a few tables here, but its all about the pastries, like tortas and smaller refrigerated pastries, too. Yum
author: Kevin F.

description: Found this little bakery by chance when we were walking to the Fishermen's Wharf and needed some coffee. They looked like they had good pastries and the sacripantina looked especially delicious so we split a slice. I was not disappointed. It was not overly sweet and had a great texture - light and moist. Their drip coffee is also pretty good.
author: Ana B.

description: So Victoria has moved away from the madness of Chinatown and is still thriving at the corner of Filbert and Columbus. The traditional pastry shop still has some of the best bite-size cookies, turnovers, short cakes and panna cotta. The ratio of cream, milk and sugar is just perfect. Not too sweet but velvety and creamy. Cannoli was also tasty but you have to get there early before it was sold out. They also own Stella's on Columbus Avenue.
author: Matt Y.

description:
They're now opened in a new location diagonal from North Beach Pool.  Smaller location than the original, but same great pastries and Italian cookies.

We dropped in Sunday night right before closing time.  Desserts included a Napoleon and a tiramisu with coffee.  Decent prices.  My Napoleon had just enough smooth custard in between three crispy layers of thin sheets of puff pastry. Hubby enjoyed his tiramisu.

Not much seating but there was a corner nook comprising of a bench seat with a small round table so we pulled up some chairs and the six of us sat around it with our desserts and coffees.

Just as we finished, they flicked the lights indicating closing time so we bussed our dirty dishes and said goodbye.
author: Shirley N.

description:
One of the amazing bakeries you will visit!! Grew up with their princess cake for various different celebrations. Their cakes have just the right amount of cake, cream, almond paste and we can't forget the RUM. LOVE IT!!! Pair this cake with a nice cup of coffee or espresso and you are in heaven.

If you haven't tried their princess cake you're missing out!! Pay a visit next time you're near by.
author: Kristina S.

description:
The BF holds Victoria Pastry close to his heart as he grew up eating the Brioche and Bear claws here. Everytime we visit SF we have to go there for him and everytime we do I try different stuff and I can't figure out what he's raving about....
The cookies are always too hard, the pastries are Bleh...
The Brioche is Bleh....
Even the Hot Chocolate he gets to wash down his Brioche and Bear Claw is Bleh...
Customer Service is severly lacking and I always feel like we are bothering them when we walk in.
I am not impressed to say the very least but unfortunatly when we return to the city I will be dragged to Victoria Pastry to fufill my BF's childhood memories again and again and again.... I am not a fan but he is so to each his own!!!!
author: Ursula U.

description: Panna Cotta was light and airy. Love the sweet creaminess of this dessert. Tiramisu was delicious. Friendly and nice staff.
author: Cheryl C.

description: Since they moved it is a very different place. The selection is less, the servers not knowledgeable and the prices high. I have been going to the old location for 40+ years, but will pass on this one.
author: Ken S.

description: Got a St. Honoré cake with the family to share. It's lightness and cream puffs really stood out to me. I love light cakes as much as I do decadent ones and this one is perfect. Love the puffs on top!
author: M C.

description:
Love this place, just can't go too often if your watching your weight cause its decadent.  I believe this is the same people who own Stella's just up the street which is the more famous but really small for seating (Its great as well).

The cakes are delicious of which my favorites are the Neapolitan, Tiramisu & Strawberry Shortcake but I'm always up for trying new ones.  Some of the Chocolate look so good but they're infused with liquor which is not my preference.

Nice staff quick service great to sit outside across from Washington Park on a nice day.
author: Tom L.

description:
If you're going to go to North Beach, I firmly believe that you have to stop at Victoria's. And when you stop there, go ahead. Indulge your dessert fantasies of everything that is creamy, custardy, flakey, buttery, almond-like and just pure deliciousness. 

My must-gets are their almond torte and St. Honore cake. They do a much better job than Diandra's with their almond torte - better almond taste and better crust! Their St. Honore cake is better than Schubert's and for me, that's saying a lot! They get the pastry part just right and their whipped cream tastes oh so fresh! 

Just thinking about this makes me happy that I just bought an almond torte. 

Go get your own! I'm not sharing.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Another 3.5 stars but overall a solid bakery to relax after lunch. Has that old fashioned charm but the cushioned bench seating along the wall was a bit unclean. Cake price per slice is about the same as Stella's or other NB bakeries. Fantastic moist and even layered Princess Cake, but wished there was more of a dome of whipped cream. :)
author: Nancy Y.

description:
We stopped here because we needed an afternoon snack but nothing too big.  I got the panna cotta with fruit and a hot chocolate.  I was pretty disappointed with the panna cotta.  It was more like greek yogurt, almost no flavor.  I litterally was mixing in the hot chocolate to giv it some flavor.  The hot chocolate was really good.

My friends got a slice of the princess cake.  It has the green icing.  I took a bite of it and I was impressed!  The icing is marzipan and inside is white cake with a layer of rasberry filling.  It's just so good.  For $5 a slice it better be!  I would have given another star if the panna cotta was a little better.
author: Rachel R.

description: Yummy yummy loved the carrot cake!! We stopped by after pizza from Tony's. Looking forward to trying more pastries and cakes.
author: Jane D.

description: Omg just thinking about this place makes my mouth water ! AMAZINGLY canoli and pastries and great latte.
author: Lilly M.

description:
The cream puff and princess cake were divine. The princess cake was the one with the light green glaze. We felt like little princesses eating the cake it was so delicate. I know they are known for their cream puffs, but this cake hit the spot. 
A few people sitting here drinking coffee and reading. We found a place to sit down, but can see how it could get busy and you would have to stand and enjoy your treats.
author: Mocha G.

description: I adore the princess cake - moist cake with raspberry jam, custard, whipped cream & blanketed  in marzipan!  Oh joyful indulgence!  The italian cookies sold by the lb are delightful bites.
author: Kim S.

description:
I have to echo everyone else's comments here on the Princess Cake. AMAZING!! If you love light spongecake with whipped cream type frosting - this is as good as it gets, or pretty darn close to it.  I usually shy away from marzipan, finding it too rich for my tastes.  This was perfect. 

Looking forward to trying some more of the cakes next time.
author: Alexis D.

description:
Cute spot it was very bright and airy and smelled like fresh fruit filling.  The opposite of what I expect the Little Debbie factories smell like.

I am taking off one star and one star only because they were out of ICE!

That my friends is some planning.
author: Lucretiz C.

description:
After being on hold for 5 minutes, I kindly asked the woman on the telephone if they carried a particular item. I received a simple "no," as a reply.
After an uncomfortable silence, I asked if she knew of any places which might carry such a thing. She complained, "I've never even heard of what your asking for, so I wouldn't know where to find it."
Ignorant, unfriendly, & not helpful.
author: Frank B.

description:
I must be having bad luck with these pastry places. The cookies were $19 per pound, and we got some amaretti and amaretti with pine nuts. These amarettis were a little better than Stella's Pastry, but they weren't great. Still really chewy, but at least they were somewhat moister than Stella's. What's up with these tiny cookies too?!

Credit card purchase for over $10.
author: Jackie S.

description:
Ahh...Almond cookie dusted with powdered sugar, delicious! 
The story: I was walking around downtown reminiscing about my love for SF and how much I miss living in the city {I moved over to the East Bay...I left the center, when I was told never to leave the center...but the center became too expensive so I ventured to the crusty parts of Berkeley/Oakland hills}

Anyway, as I was saying, I was just walking along and ended up in North Beach, I needed to be refueled and stopped over at this lovely little pastry shop.

I could feel my hips expand and my ass screaming...."don't do it, for the love of all things firm and fit, don't do it!" but since my ass is just rightly taunt and round enough, I said "one Almond Paste cookie please and soy Latte." The nice lady working behind the counter hooked me up and I was pleasantly surprised and delighted to be enjoying 2 treats in my favorite city in the whole wide state of California! 

What makes Victoria Pastry company a great place to sip a latte and enjoy the scenery is just that; it is a chill place, yummy treats that will make you walk your ass up a hill...say Filbert! and its San Francisco!

Yup, I'll be back.
author: Valerie D.

description:
Adorable little shop with some cute paintings of cake and cupcakes along their walls in Little Italy. 

My friend and I walked in and looked at what they had to offer in their display. When she asked the man working there what the pastries on a certain shelf were, he lazily responded "You want me to tell you ALL of them?!" I can understand working long hours in a busy environment, but doing your best to help customers is a part of the job, period.

As for the actual pastries, we decided upon the chocolate mousse cake. It wasn't as good as we were hoping it would be, and it was a little pricey at $4.75 a slice.

If I ever come back, it will be to try the Princess Cake that everyone here on Yelp seems to love!
author: Fiana L.

description: Best Coffee I have ever had, period. Don't want to say much. I got the double shot latte and I can't even begin to explain how smooth, rich, bold and delicious it was. So coming back to City just to have coffee here.
author: Madhuri D.

description: Was visiting the area & walked past this place after they'd closed so had to go back this morning & check them out.  Cute little place & nice display counter staffed by friendly, helpful clerk.  I got a custard danish & bought my hubby a slice of their almond cake, both quite yummy.  I also got a bag of assorted small cookies, so far, all of them are pretty tasty too!
author: Sara K.

description:
As a native San Franciscan, I'm ashamed to say that this past weekend was the first time I ever walked into this pastry shop. I frequent Chinatown every weekend for my weekly veggie and fruit shopping and Vietnamese food or dim sum fix, yet I never thought of walking in here to try their pastries....until I suddenly had a craving for cannollis. I don't know why, but I haven't had a cannoli since I've accepted my lactose-intolerance status years ago. I think the last time I had one was...10 years ago (?) from Dianda's Bakery here in the Mission. And here I was, craving for a connolli and I think it's because Lent is upon us and I usually give-up certain foods during Lent, including dessert, but cannolis??  Anyhoo, instead of stopping by Dianda's  on the way home (I live nearby), I thought I'd try this place since I was already in the area getting my pho fix. 

As I walked-in, there was a lot of chatter from the patrons who were in there having coffee and pastries as an afternoon snack. No, not Italian, but Cantonese =). Remember, Chinatown is a hop, skip away. So the display was pretty empty. They still had cookies and various whole and slices of cakes, but I didn't see any cannolis. I was the next person to be helped and I told the young woman that I wanted two cannolis. She looked in the display case and of course she didn't say any left, but told me she would go to the back to get some. From what I've read in a previous review, they make their cannollis made to order. I paid for my cannollis ahead of time and about 5 min. later, she came back out with small box of cannolis =). I was happy. I now had my cannollis to satisfy my craving and dessert fix before Lent. 

Since I had two, I decided to only eat one with my tea when I got home and save the other for the next day. I was happy with my choice. Filling was firm and not runny, not too sweet, and had mini chocolate chips with a marachino cherry on each end. Mmmm....good choice, although I was eyeing there slice of tiramisu in t heir display case. Hmmm.....I just might have to go back on Monday or Tuesday before Lent to try that =D. 

Oh, the cannolis set me back $8.50 ($4.25 for each). A little pricey?? Hmmm....I'll have to compare prices with Dianda's. In any case, it was delicious treat for me =).
author: Neni E.

description:
I was starving for a mid-afternoon snack and a coffee. We were strolling our way to the Wharf and came across this gem on the way.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. I ended up splitting a slice of Princess cake and let me tell you that was heavenly. Splitting it was perfect, its a rather large slice (it is $5 mind you). The bottom layer was soaked in triple sec I believe, with a pistachio layer and a marzipan icing. I would order a whole cake anytime (too bad I love in SoCal). The latte was good and hit the spot.

I would definitely stop in next time I am craving a decadent piece of cake.
author: Michelle P.

description: We had a Princess cake, delicious, as well as a selection of their smaller cakes and everything was perfect. Not too buttery or sugary compare to other so called bakeries.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description:
This bakery is traditional - but does everything right.  My husband and I stopped in and bought several pasties to share and a couple of coffees.   

The chocolate croissant was stand out, but everything we had was delicious.

This is on my list of must haves when I visit San Francisco.
author: AJ F.

description:
This is the best bakery ever!! We have been going to this bakery since we were kids!! My birthday cakes always were the rum cakes! Anyone that does not appreciate this place is probably one of our "beloved" (not) 20 somethings from another state who come here and think they are "entitled" (not) and have no idea what a real bakery is even it is hit them in the empty head! (lol).

Love you VICTORIA PASTRY!!!! From all your local fans!! :-)
author: Yvonne J.

description:
This makes me really sad to give this place only 1 star but I HAVE to. The first time I went to Victoria's it was in a different location, and the shop was pretty big. It had an old time Italian feel to it, the walls were all painted with murals, and the dessert casses were filled with every little Italian pastry you could imagine. The people who worked there were very nice and they accomodated the large group I was in with ease. Went to North Beach recently with my hubby and we thought we would check out the new location and sit in the sun at the nearby Washington Square.

What a mistake that was!! So many Italian bakeries in this area that we could have spent our money in and we choose this place. 

First off, we walk in, excited to be there, me thinking its going to be like my last visit, and we are immediatly ignored by the person behind the counter. She was cleaning the espresso machine and was too busy to even greet us with a "hello". 

We then started our order, starting off with a dozen pignoli cookies, 2 canolis, and another type of almond cookie that had powdered sugar and slivered almonds on top of them. The woman that was helping us not only took her sweet a** time, but she made a mess by getting the canoli cream on the side of the bag, and throwing the pignoli cooking in the bag like they were rocks. 

While she was abusing the pastries we ordered, I asked to use the restroom, since the sign on the restroom said "for customers only". Well I am going to buy all those pastries so I am a customer. She didn't even look up from what she was doing and said "yeah its right there" and pointed to the restroom door.

To top off this already negative experience, my husband asked for an iced latte since we were going to sit in the sun at the park and it was such a nice day out. Rudly, this same woman said, "I can't we dont have any ice." Are you serious?!? I get it, somtimes you run out of materials and you have to tell the customer no, but dont make it seem like it is OUR fault that YOU ran out of ice. That is extremely terrible customer service and bad manners in general. My husband settles for a hot latte and she hands him a cup with coffee all down the sides and gives us a total for the goods. 

Not only was the service down right unacceptable, the canolis were soggy and the ricotta tasted a little sour. We ending up giving the nasty pastries to a homeless man who was very excited to receive it. The pignoli cookies are always the best, and you have to almost try to mess up this cookie, but Im sure i can fine another bakery in the area that will have a better product and they treat their customers with at least respect that I would be happy to give my money to.
author: Lizzie D.

description: Victoria has been my go to pastry shop for years.  Everything is good.  Everything is freshly made with quality ingredients.  My special occasion cakes are purchased here as well as cookies, cream puffs, cannoli and other desserts.  I'm never disappointed.  The Zabaione, Princess and Italian Rum cakes are scrumptious and are a wonderful end to a special meal.
author: Donna P.

description:
Old fashioned Italian pastries that looks like they never have a renovation inside. They have these delicious cookies by pound by they are pretty steep. 

It is one of the most pastry shop in little Italy though. Everyone should come at least once before Chinese takes over!
author: Athena C.

description: chocolate eclair with whipped cream. i die.
author: Archana P.

description: A must go to when you're in the SF area. The princess cake is amazing, as well as the cream puffs and cannoli's. It doesn't get much better than the pastries you will find here. Just go in and try a cookie at the least, you'll see...
author: Mike S.

description:
terrible chocolate chip cookie. dry and bland.

why would you do this to me?

sad, crumbly disaster.
author: Sam A.

description:
Americano was weak, and bitter. For me, that's the worst possible combination!

One staff member was really nice, the other sullen and unfriendly.

Treats looked nice but what's the point if the coffee is that poor?!
author: Izzy T.

description: Victoria has a long history in NB but customer service is lacking sorely.  Had only two pastries & they're the Bomb Tasty & pretty to look at.  Shortage of sitting, however, partly this site has become touristy but locals do take out.  Customer service picky on who they talk to first.  We're all 1st's, come on, we're paying customers!  Even the 2nd in line will become a 1st in line!
author: BanBan B.

description:
my birthday cake was a princess cake from victoria pastry company. it was light fluffy cake with layers of custard, whipped cream, and raspberry jam--all covered in marzipan. 

i can't compare this to other princess cakes because victoria was my first, but i have to say that the cake was very pretty and tasted amazing..... 

great.... now i'm craving cake.
author: Christine K.

description:
Nice bakery, friendly staff and good service. I enjoyed the pastry I bought from this bakery. I can tell they are really into achieving excellence in customer service. I enjoyed then pastry I bought from here and will definitely come here for my pastry cravings.

UPDATE: 6/21/2012
There is a sign posted saying their bakery is moving to 700 Filbert St. Looks like the lease for this bakery is about to expire or something?

REVISION:
Their bakery is now at 700 Filbert St right by Washington Square Park.

9/11/2015
The cannoli is delicious, it's one of the best pastries I have ever had and enjoyed it. This is one of the pastry shops I have patronized. Staff members on duty were very friendly and the service was very good.
author: Bennett W.

description:
I now have 3 loves in my life and the Princess cake is now one of them. I love this so much that I have searched high and low for a bakery in my own state who makes this and have FAILED!!! ALL I CAN THINK ABOUT IS THIS CAKE.  

So I am coming back to San Francisco in November and my first agenda will be to go get this cake. Off the plane and go get cake. Am I obsessed? Yes and that is putting it mildly.

The bakery has plenty of other options also and a few table to sit at while you eat your slice of cake and drink your coffee. While I was there a fireman came in and got a whole box for the guys back at the house. And you know what they say anywhere the police or firemen eat had to be good.
author: Cris F.

description: This place is a San Francisco landmark, there is a reason this bakery has been around for over 100 years and it's not just the amazing pasties and cookies but the service is excellent! We have been coming here forever. My mom had their Italian cookies, at her wedding over 40 years ago and now I will have Victoria's cookies at my wedding when I get married later this year.  The pastries are amazing and the cookies are excellent. If you have not experienced Victoria's Pastry Company, it is definitely worth checking out, you will not be disappointed!
author: Kristina L.

description: Finally cannoli ! Great to see parts of North Beach stay with their original Italian charm !
author: Armando Z.

description: I had a blueberry pastry and was disappointed.  It seems like a good local spot but maybe I just got the wrong thing.  I can't say the place looked rundown but it wasn't spic and span either.  The staff was friendly though and though disappointed it seemed like those in the area do enjoy this place.
author: Mark A.

description: Just devoured a magnificent panna cotta topped with berries (you can choose the one with berries or chocolate). I honestly don't know where else to buy panna cotta because not every bakery will make it, so I bought it immediately. It was really rich and creamy, and definitely large enough to share with a friend or two. Will definitely be back to try their princess cake one day!
author: Jeanette S.

description: Had a chocolate and coconut cookie. Very good. Nice seating in the window. Would be great on a cold day.
author: David H.

description: We tried the zabaione mousse cake and the triple layer chocolate cake, both were excellent. We got ours to go. There is not a lot of seating. I would come back here.
author: Nicole X.

description:
The Tiramisu is INCREDIBLE!!!  Once I tried this- I Always get this perfect delicate moist desert! It is sooooooo good!! (licking lips thinking about it)
oh-
They have a chocolate cake with shaved dark chocolate on top---Oh Dear!! Babe babe babe..I work myself up thinking about these delish treats!!!
author: Jp P.

description:
My husband can not get his fill of the almond cookies!!

Our first experience was through Chris Milano Foodie Adventure. We went back several times after to the bakery before we left San Fran. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. This will be definitely on our places to visit when we are back in the bay area.
author: Denise L.

description: This place is amazing! I love their Italian sodas!
author: Yvette L.

description: Had the amaretti and pignoli cookies. Very chewy and yummy.  For 1/8 of a lb. it was over $5 which was quite spendy but it was worth a try as I love these cookies.  I was longingly looking at the princess cakes which everyone seemed to be buying. Tis place is very popular but parking was difficult. I believe that each slide was $4.50. Nice feature: clean bathroom and seating area.
author: Kitty D.

description:
This place is kinda "lost" in the middle of Chinatown so I never thought it's one of the good pastry shop. Ambiance and view are meh, so just get your pastries to go.

The danish is flakey and very big, the almond cookies are soft and delicious (prefer the one without almond chunks), and the biscotti is good as well.

I haven't tried the princess cake yet, but definitely need to do that in one of my cheat days. Damn diet!

Love how this place is kinda hidden so I'll definitely come back to this place.
author: Novalina N.

description: the desserts are absolutely delicious! the sacripantina is super light and fluffy, and has a hint of lemon which is refreshing! the hazelnut cookies have the perfect balance of sweetness! and the their raspberry shortbread cookies are delicious as well! i will definitely come again!
author: Mary ..

description: I needed a princess cake for Thanksgivukkah dinner and found a delicious one here! I loved the fact they let me pay over the phone and that they were open until 8pm. Although I only tried the princess cake, they had a great variety of cookies, cakes and pies in their cases. After such a great experience with the princess cake, I'll be sure to return in the future.
author: Kelsey K.

description: I've only had cannoli 4 or 5 times in my life, and Victoria's is the only one I like.  Pricey ($4.25), but good - crispy and filling was rich and not overly sweet.
author: MT Y.

description:
Wandered in here one day since I keep hearing about this place. The girl was sweeping the floors. 

"Hello," I said quietly. She didn't hear me and continued sweeping. 

"Excuse me," I said a little louder. 

"Yeah?" 

I was a tad taken aback; she didn't seem happy to see me. Granted, it must've been close to closing time, but still. Undeterred, I asked what the bakery was known for in terms of baked items. To her credit, she answered with a list of stuff, just not stuff I like to eat. 

So I decided to go with a cream puff. She said sure, walked over to the case, and took the cream puff out. (Remember, she was sweeping floors before this. And she wasn't wearing gloves.) I happened to look where she was holding the puff, and she had her bare thumb ON the top of the cream puff. There was no napkin between her thumb and the puff, the former of which was in contact with a dirty broom not too long before that. 

When she saw I was watching, she did wrap up the puff before putting it into the bag, all without touching the pastry. I went and paid for it and ate it just because I had to satisfy my sweet tooth. 

So in summary:

- Don't go in right before closing and order stuff, especially if they're sweeping up. OR if you must, then keep a close eye to make sure hygienic practices are followed. 

- Customer service attitude wasn't great, but it was late in the day.

- 3 stars for the cream puff. Not the best I've had, but it was decent. 

I likely won't go back.
author: Evelyn C.

description: My hubby and I found this place on our recent trip to San Fran.  I saw a lady walking down the street with a white box wrapped in string and I had to find where she got it.  We came upon this cute little bakery and our eyes lit up when we saw all the goodness inside!! We got a bunch of raspberry filled butter cookies, sprinkle butter cookies, cheesecake, brownie, strawberry shortcake, and peanut butter cookies.  We went back 2 more times during our trip!! The best peanut butter cookies ever!!!!!! My husband was in heaven.  I loved the butter cookies!! We will be back again in November and will be making a few trips to this amazing bakery!
author: Karen T.

description:
Is everything here 5 stars? No. But is a slice of the Princess Cake (or a whole cake) 5 stars? Ab-so-friggin-lutely!!! 

I've lived in the neighborhood for over 1.5 years and walked by here countless times and never paid attention. Then I heard through the grapevine that Victoria Pastry is the bees knees and had been a part of the neighborhood forever. Now time to try it...

Since I was having a fat kid rainy Saturday night at home Netflixing, the next thing that caught my eye was another dessert I can't remember the name of, but it started with "stra-" and then something, and it was like tiramisu but no espresso. Okay, but not very exciting. I liked the Princess Cake better. 

I also tried the Panna Cotta with chocolate. Not bad, but not the Princess Cake. It needed a little more chocolate and another flavor. 

Long story short, just go for the Princess Cake...Unless you don't want a new addiction, because I'm seriously about to be a regular customer.
author: Steph A.

description:
Moist . dark . rich . balanced

Victoria Pastry Company has one of the best Chocolate Truffle Cakes IMO.

I was told that if you leave it out, the gooey-ness makes for a creamier cake. 

Have patience, the service can be slow, nonetheless they are old school nice.

I haven't gotten past experiencing this cake, but they do have a tempting array of cookies and pastries here too.
author: Cathy K.

description: The best panacotta in the city. Love this place. Quite and pleasant atmosphere. Friendly personnel and good location.
author: Liliia R.

description: Victoria Pastry Company, of their displayed location, in the last few weeks, has been in the process of MOVING from their decades-long location at the corner of Stockton and Vallejo to a new spot at the corner of Powell and Filbert Streets. They expect to be open VERY SOON, and the place will be a modernized and beautYful shop that everyone will be amazed with! There is a huge colorful mural on the Powell Street side which is just plain gorgeous!
author: Tony L.

description: Pastries are good but they're a little overpriced considering what they are. I'd pay a premium if I thought this place was really better than others but it's not. That being said, their pastries are still good--I just wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Diana Y.

description: Great service,strong coffee,and the BEST cookies we've had years. We stopped in for coffee and to try a few different cookies. Ended up back a couple hours later because we didn't find anything better or really close anywhere else. Definitely recommend and will be going back.
author: Don M.

description: Victoria Pastry employs my "Employee of the Year": Megan. I got my bag stolen while I had to take a call around the corner. Not only that, but the thief also ate my cheese cake. In Megan's absolute awesomeness was able to recognize the thief 2 hours later when the thief for some lucky reason passed the shop again and retrieve my bag for me. And she even offered me another cheese cake (which was delicious). Tip her well for me!
author: Nam C.

description: Very average pastries and baked goods. Nothing extraordinary. Not sure how it got 4 stars.
author: Maria T.

description: I bought some cannoli and cupcakes to bring to a party and everyone was very impressed.
author: Amy S.

description: Nice European feel corner pastry shop. Nice outdoor seating along the busy Columbus ave. good chocolate pastries.
author: 49er ..

description: We were referred by our friends in Florida who have really fond memories of this bakery. We stopped in and picked up a variety of cookies and piece of St Honore cake. Everything was delicious!
author: Kathaleen C.

description: my family gets my birthday cake here every year when i was a kid. and as to today my fav cake is still their Princess cake and their St. Honorie cake... you need to request the color of the princess cake if you want it in pink or else you will end up with green.. all their cakes are moist and fresh.. to me the princess cake is not to sweet which is perfect. l ove how the St. Honorie cake has little cream puffs at the top and the inside has a thin layer of crust.. the only think i don't like is the service here.. there are times where they are nice to you but there are times there is a mean lady around here.
author: Belinda C.

description: Fist visit, it was a great experience and I'm sure I'll be back, thank you for the best cannolis and service!
author: Bernadette E.

description:
This is an awesome 95 year old Italian bakery in the middle of North Beach.  When I visit SF, North Beach is one of my must-visit sites because it has some of my favorite food.

What I had here was a raspberry tart and some of their cookies.  

Although stuff isn't really cheap here, my friends and I absolutely loved them!  

1. RASPBERRY TART:  This had a nice hard crust and the middle was crumbly with raspberry filling.  It was topped with strutsel, powdered sugar, and something else.  My friends and I loved this.  Because this dish has so many layers, we felt it was interesting because we picked up slightly different flavors with each bite.  
2. COOKIES.   Their cookies are amazing, but you'll pay for them.  Check out my pictures to see which ones we chose.   If you do get cookies...definitely ask for their recommendations.  Our favorite was that almond shortbread cookie.  It was crispy on the outside, but surprisingly chewy in the middle.  The chewyness was kinda fruity-nougaty, for lack of a good term.  

This Italian bakery has been around forever, they're super helpful, and the food tastes great.  Definitely make a stop here while you're in the area.  I also recommend checking out Molinari Deli (down the street) and XOX truffles.  

This review is part of my "AWESOME SF DAYTRIP" list.  Check my profile to see my other recommendations.
author: Ken C.

description: Strawberry Cake taste mediocre, but couldn't resist to pay $5 slice because they have a nice seating in front of a shop. I rather go to Cafe Puccini if I only want to enjoy Cannoli and a cup of Coffee. I usually get Princess Cake from Miette, but Victoria's Princess Cake looks good. I would like to try next time.
author: Vicki S.

description:
Choose your baked goods carefully here because they are really hit or miss!  I tried 3 things:
1) Almond-Raspberry jam tart - DIVINE!!  Inside the shell was a very flavorful frangipane filling.
2) Cannoli - decent, they pipe the filling to order so the shell stays crisp.
3) Cherry danish - AWFUL!  It was so stale it should not have even been for sale!  
Also, the lady serving us was kind of cold and rude.  I would not come out of my way to return when there are plenty of other bakeries in the city with better pastries and customer service.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Friendly service, great baked goods, great location and good prices for the items! Had a chocolate chip cookie tasted home made nice and soft with a little crunch to it. Mocha drink was good. Nice outdoor seating to people watch. 

I will def be visiting this bakery again!
author: Amanda C.

description: Yay!!!The new place opens on Filbert at Powell. They have a few tables. A good place to enjoy the view of Washington Square. You can see the kitchen from the tables too. It's very clean and new. So happy with this new place.
author: V L.

description: From all of the reviews we expected the best only to be very disappointed. Tried the cake and felt you can find a way better price for the same quality. My wife ordered a mocha and waited for 5 min. And when she went to ask for it they said they FORGOT about it and they didn't charge her for it. So she pulled the receipt and said yes you did charge me! And all she could say was then you must have gotten it already because we have no orders up here?! WTF! So we walked 5 dollars less and no drink!  NEVER AGAIN!
author: Alexerica A.

description:
I found Victoria Pastry last year. The chocolate Napolean wooed me, it was love at first bite. I returned, and was saddened that this experience was flawed. The lady that assisted us was snippy and a bit rude. We knew exactly what we wanted, it should have been easy to please. The Napoleans (we had chocolate and whipped cream) were stale. The layers were tough and both we hard to eat. I was crushed. 

The three stars rating is an average of my two experiences.
author: Kellee K.

description:
I have been going here since I was born! I frequent this place a lot because I used to go to Chinatown every other week and this place is RIGHT there. This place makes authentic, from scratch Italian desserts as well as other pastries and cookies.

I am not a fan of chocolate cake but I do like them here! Their Saint Honore cake is definitely a must when you have to bring dessert for a family/friend function. The princess cake is good, and so are the other ones. I try to get different KINDS of cakes everytime I order one, but it seems like I always get the default cakes since I'm afraid of trying something new since it always, always backfires on me. =P
author: Meena N.

description:
I thank Yelp for originally leading me to Victoria's and I thank Yelp a second time for being so "on" (as usual) when pointing me in the right direction. While recently in town visiting my parents, we made a day in the city and while we were exploring, our sweet teeth suggested we stop for a breather. Since we were in North Beach, I knew we were surrounded by bakeries, but the real question was...what one should we go to? I didn't have to look very far because Yelp pointed me in the direction of Victoria Pastry Company. 

This bakery is as delicious as everyone else says it is. It's simple, doesn't have (or need) frills and serves delicious sweets that hit the spot. They have a wider variety of daytime sweets but they still have a small selection of breakfast pastries. My two favorites were the lemon bars and and a long cinnamon/apple breakfast pastry (not sure what its exact name was, but just look for the long rectangular pastry topped with delicious looking frosting). 

The guy behind the counter claimed the lemon bars were the best there is and although I had already reached my sweet capacity for the day, we couldn't leave without trying one out. The guy was right folks. Those lemon bars are some of the best out there and I really didn't think the taste of lemon bar could vary, but I was wrong. They top these lemon bars with a crumbly, crust-like topping that is the perfect twist. The lemon filling is sweet and creamy and it would be easy to eat a entire bar in one sitting. 

I can't wait to visit SF again so that I can make a trip to Victoria's.
author: Lindsey D.

description: I like the new location Filbert and Columbus because it's closer to me.  Oh, so good.  Cookies by the pound, excellent eclairs, cakes and cannoli.  Not overly sweet, but overly delicious.  Stop in for a cup of coffee or tea and a snack.  You don't be disappointed.
author: t d.

description: I used to love the St Honore cakes from here, but after the move the don't seem the same.  Victoria's St Honore cakes were almost as good as Andrew's Bake Shoppe that used to be inside the United Market in San Rafael.  Andrew's is long gone now but they were the best.
author: Johnny F.

description:
Just had the pleasure of walking into the new location on Filbert! I love it! Much better place and great view of Wash Park plus it seems to fit better providing more of a North Beach feel on this corner.
Cheese Danish with blueberries and a large cup of joe 4 bucks. Perfect. 
The pastry is the best I have ever had. So soft and flaky outer ring and delicious creamy center.

Thank you! Thank you!
author: Luke G.

description: They have great princess cake and cookies!  They are near the top of my list for go-to bakery on special occasions.  I just wish they still had the black and white cookies.  I remember those the first time I came here 16 years ago.  Why no black and whites?
author: Angelique B.

description: A whole lotta yum. Reminds me of the Italian bakery in the neighborhood I grew up in. We had a sampling of all the little things I don't know the names of, lol. The one with pine nuts is sooo good. Everything we had was  yummy, coffee was good, service was friendly, and prices were fair. Yum.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Delicious canollis!  Ricotta filling was delicious and creamy, and not too sweet.  Hand filled when ordered, which meant the shell and filling were not overly chilled, which is the way I like it.  Comes wtih a few mini-chocolate chips mixed in and marachino cherries.  (I could do without the cherries, but all in all it was tasty.)  

If you are familiar with Boston's canolli's, this is better than Mike's but not as good as Modern's.  

Sort of pricey, but worth it.  Parking is difficult, park on street anywhere you can find it!
author: J L.

description: They were selected to do my brother and sister-in-law's wedding cake.  A buttercream zabaione cake.  There was a point during the wedding reception when the dance floor emptied and the party got quiet.... Everyone was devouring the cake.  It is hands down the best cake I have ever had (and I got leftover cake)!  Amazing!!!
author: Alex D.

description: The eclairs were average. I have tasted better ones. The hot chocolate was average too. A little bit pricey.
author: Pal T.

description: The cappuccino was good, but the pastries did not wow. The cream pastry (sandwich like) had pretty dry bread. The cream filling was ok. The biscotti were pretty good.
author: Gopi V.

description:
i thought it was a chinese bakery at first when i saw the patrons who were Asian sipping away their coffee. 
they have a lot of pastries in stock, but none of them had labels on them making you guess whatever it is youre looking at. the only labels were pricing. the items they had looked like theyve been sitting for a while as well.
I was not acknowledged by the 2 people behind the counter either, so i moved on.
author: Anita W.

description: Absolutely the best scone I have ever had! They sell out very quick, smart to call ahead and make sure they have them before you go.
author: Danielle R.

description: St. Honore cake is just amazing...
author: JK C.

description: i had the BEST experience with Victoria Pastry company over the weekend my close friend wanted a princess cake for her birthday party and after several phone calls with the nice customer service reps and a confrence call with the person the cake was being made for the cake turned out beautifully....i got a look at it and snapped a few photos before dropping it off at my friend's party i was very impressed with the work they put in....it was EXACTLY how she wanted it! everyone who saw and tried the cake loved it! i just wanted to thank you for the good experience i'll definitely refer people to your shop!
author: Jeff M.

description: Victoria Pastry Company is my favourite old Italian Bakery. Others may be obsessed with the Princess Cake, but I'm a St. Honoré Cake man myself. And even though this place could almost now be in Chinatown, it's still a welcome old fashioned North Beach anchor. Service is old school nice and the selection reminds me of what Mama used to make!
author: Eric B.

description: Incredibly rude server works there (at least in the evenings) who is apparently more interested in her text messages than in serving the clients of this otherwise renowned bakery.  Unclear why they put up with her in light of the bad reviews of her service. She is known for her glares and surly responses to questions.
author: Chas J.

description: LOve love loved it! Came here on a Wednesday early afternoon with a friend and ordered the strawberry shortcake ( delicious !!!! ) had the tiramisu and Mille-feuilles to go. Everything was just perfect! We also tried their princess cake and oatmeal raisin cookie ( both crazy delicious). I will be back for more really soon!
author: Vickie Z.

description: Best princess cake. 100-year SF bakery.
author: Stella Y.

description: I bought some cookies to munch on as I walked around the city. I asked for a recommendation, and the girl behind the counter suggested the wedding cookies and the chocolate thumbprint - just the ones I had been eyeing. Great choice. They sell by the pound ($20.50) so I got 1/4 lb. Delicious!
author: Courtney N.

description: Not as good as Stella's pastry. The cannolis are good. You have to ask them for the cannolis because they store them in a refrigerator that you can't see. The Napoleons and Tiramisu cakes looked good. I'd like to go back again.
author: Denise C.

description:
So disappointed, but I shall give them a neutral review.  

So I'm planning my trip to SF.  I read on Yelp about them moving?!  I called and they said that Friday 6/29/12 (on the day that I come in) will be their last day at this location on Stockton St!  They said that they will be closed and will not be fully moved in to their new location just yet.

So bummed.  Guess I'll have to come up to SF again to visit them in their new locale.
author: Cindy K.

description:
This is just for pastries. I tried a fruit tart type thing. The crust was pretty thin and overly almond flavored for me (although this could be to the liking of others). What was kind of gross was the "fruit" on top, which was something resembling nectarine jelly, and bore no relation to any kind of real fruit. It was overly sweet and had an almost gummy texture. I'm not a big fan of Italian cookies in general, so those never grab me, but the rest of the pastries didn't look appealing either.

However, I might have different feelings about the cakes, so I'll update if I get around to trying them.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Mangia e statti zitto!

This is something I heard growing up in an Italian family.  Basically it means "eat and stay quiet"; or as my papa says "shut up and eat".  

No trip to SF is complete without a visit to Victoria Pastry Company.  We made sure to stop by before lunch.  Life is short...eat dessert first.  Well we didn't actually eat the dessert before lunch.  We just wanted to make sure to get our treats.

My sister is obsessed with the Princess cake.  I have not had the pleasure of sampling this delicacy because she always manages to eat it in secrecy.  I love the almond torta.  It is perfect for breakfast with a nice cup of hot tea.  The cookies are yummy.  So many different options!  The cannoli?  Perfection!  They also sell tortoni candy which is one of my faves.  Chewy, almondy goodness.

After a visit to Victoria Pastry Company, you will definitely say "Mangia e statti zitto" too!  ;)
author: Karen G.

description: A North Beach icon, seems like it's been around forever.  Usually I've come in for breakfast so I've had the chocolate croissant, the blueberry cheese pastry, and an eclair.  All were super delicious.  Flaky pastry crust, buttery goodness, and lots of filling.  A tad bit sweet though.  The rest of my group really enjoyed their pastries, so a solid experience all around.  We'll be back to try more!
author: Jeff C.

description: This used to be one of my favorite Italian cafés in SF, before they moved to Washington Square. Not any more! I was served one of the worse cappuccinos ever, not even close to being worth the $3.25. The froth disappeared in minutes and I was left with one-third cup of coffee and milk. It was truly disappointing and soured my interest in being a return customer. What a shame!
author: Mp D.

description: Great pastry! They are over 100 years in the business. Great cakes and pastry. Staff is awesome and friendly.
author: Kap G.

description: Absolutely the best of the best!  As far as I know, this is the only place that knows how to make St. Honore Cake in the old Sicilian way!  Our family has been known to drive 4 hours to pick up this cake for a wedding reception!  A dear cousin went out of her way to bring one down to my father's 90th birthday celebration.  Very few have even heard of this cake, let alone do it so well! Over the decades, our family says, "Thank you" again and again!
author: E M J.

description:
I've been getting their princess cake and raspberry almond "tart" for my birthday every year since I came to America (19 years ago).

The marzipan is thin and not overwhelming.

The cake itself is light.

The cream is fluffy.

The raspberry "inbetweens" is perfectly sweet.

I don't have anything negative to say about this place!!
author: Lin L.

description: A ginormous slice of tiramisu along with the house coffee capped off a nice afternoon. There was so...much...sugary...flavor!
author: Derek N.

description: We stopped by during the North Beach Festival. They didn't have any sliced cakes available so I got the almond paste tart with raspberries. I thought the dessert was too sweet, especially with the massive amount of powdered sugar dusted on top. My boyfriend didn't like his coffee all that much either. All in all, the place disappointed. With all the bakeries in the area, don't think we'll be coming back.
author: Alice W.

description: This review is for their princess cake. Best princess cake I've had so far (I've tried a few from different places before). The cake is structured so perfectly and so pretty to look at. It tastes just as good as it looks.
author: HM N.

description: Growing up in Upstate New York and being Italian, you kind of develop a taste for what true Italian pastries should taste like. I had the best cannoli in California at this joint.
author: Adam C.

description: I hate to write a bad review but this place has disappointed me a few times too many.  I've gone in here (always with a smile no matter how early) and the service has been poor every time.  This morning I walked in a got a tea with 2 tea bags and the woman charged me double because I got two tea bags.  $4.30 for a hot tea? Now, this isn't organic or special blend tea we're talking about either.  It's LIPTON tea, straight out of a box that costs less than what I paid for it.  Another time, I went in there and the woman behind the counter took her sweet time greeting me, let alone servine me and then different time I went in there and she helped people that came after me before she took my order.  It makes me sad because I love to support local businesses in my favorite neighborhood but I will be finding another business to support.  Hopefully the service will improve for their sake.
author: Dimitra H.

description:
Get the crostata for your next special occasion!  I went to Victoria to get apple and pumpkin pies for Thanksgiving and thankfully stumbled upon their crostata.  We got the raspberry flavor and it didn't last more than an hour - the pie is light, with a bit of almond crunch.  And the jam-like filling balances out the pastry - perfect for light dessert or morning pastry.  

Also, the tiramisu is HEAVENLY.  It costs $5.50 but it's worth every cent.  Somehow, the lady fingers keep their sponginess even when they're soaked with flavor.  The cream is light and the powdered cocoa/coffee topping is delicious.

Please note that Victoria Pastry moved in Aug 2012 to the corner of Filbert/ Powell, just a few blocks from its original location. The new space is right across from Washington Square and is bright, airy and a great spot to people watch.   

Victoria Pastry = Old school italian bakery.  The ladies behind the counter are super-nice - they gave my kids a couple of cookies while we waited for the apple pie to come out of the oven!  They're also known for their princess cake, the St Honore cake and cannolli.

With the new location, it's become a new neighborhood gathering spot.  It's a must-visit in North Beach.
author: Serena S.

description:
Spending much of my youth in the North Beach and Chinatown area I've had my share of the Victoria St. Honore cake as it was always a family favorite.  My brother and sister would often pick up a cake from here for any special occasion because it was always so much better than any of the Chinatown cakes.  I rarely visit the North Beach area these days, but while in the neighborhood this afternoon I decided to drop in for a taste treat from the past.

I shared a Napoleon with a friend.  The pastry was flaky, but it was a bit chewy maybe from sitting around for awhile.  The custard was quite good as it oozed out between the layers of pastry creating a delicious mess.  We also shared a slice of the Princess cake, and it was this that brought back all of those great memories from my youth.  I'm not a big fan of marzipan, but combined with the moist cake, the whipped cream, the thin line of raspberry filling ... wow!  It was not overly sweet and just delicious.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
They pride themselves of their princess cakes and eclairs. I tried the princess cake and it was nice and sweet. Very sweet, actually. I also tried their hazelnut cake which was new. Also very sweet. Everything in here is sweet. Beware! But if you think your sweet tooth can handle it, I think you'll like this place.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
This historic bakery has been around 90 years. It is still running strong til this day. It has older local Italians, whosever left from the earlier generation, still coming to this corner bakery, even when Chinese taking over the North Beach, in which the Italians use to dominate. 

Every single pastries there is good. Recipes made since the opening of day-1, still used today . They have great Italian cookies and there Cannoli's is a must-have. I buy "lady-fingers" at this bakery to make my own tiramisu. And yes, they have good Tiramisu too. Everything is original. No Costco items @ this bakery.

Support and eat @ Victoria's Pastry, before the chinese takeover and build a rat-infested business.
author: Matt G.

description: The cake was pretty tasty, but wish they had better customer service. Ordered a 12 inch princess cake per recommendations from the staff over the phone to feed 20-25 people. Be warned-the cake feeds more like 40. They misspelled the requested name on the cake (after spelling it 3 times on the phone order) and the staff resisted correcting it.
author: Jay K.

description: The black and white cake was great, and the coffee was hot. The staff was really friendly, too!
author: Jose M.

description: Wonderful pastries and cakes, they have whipped cream frosting which is the best! But the staff and customer service is horrible!!  It's a small place and the people working there don't seem to care.
author: Jaime K.

description: My kids love their sprinkle cookies!! Wide variety of pastries. I don't think you can go wrong here.
author: Cynthia L.

description: I have been buying my cream horns and allumette cookies at Victoria Pastry for a very long time and was disheartened to hear that they were relocating to another location, but happy to know that they will continue selling their pastries on Filbert & Columbus.  I finally was able to make it down to the new location and was very displeased with their service.  The young woman who helped me was not courteous or friendly, and I wonder why management continue to do their company a disservice by hiring such unsavory help.  For the pastries, Victory Pastry gets 'five stars' and for service, well, they get none.
author: Pendragon D.

description: My fiance and I spent a good 5 minutes trying to decide what to order! We settled on slices of princess and chocolate & raspberry cakes. I wanted to try an eclair too, maybe next time. Both were delish. Mmmm that custard. I am very happy to have found a decent bakery for dessert next time I have a craving. Service was fine for us. The girl behind the counter explained what various pastries and cakes were without attitude.
author: Miffy Y.

description: Short review. Smelled great. Tasted great. Coffee from a canister?  Homeless sitting outside on their chairs so we couldn't sit outside. Nice people inside. Quiet, why?  Smelled great, tasted great.
author: John M.

description: Walking around North Beach and was trying to find a good quick place for a morning pastry and coffee. Saw Victoria and decided to give it a try. Nice cafe and good service. Ordered a cannoli which was excellent. I didn't try anything else but I liked what I had. Look forward to trying more.
author: Aaron A.

description:
Friendly staff; falls short with the cakes but stands out with the macaroons/cookies.. 

I tried their Princess Cake.  It's only ok when it comes to the flavor.. it also loses points because of the thick fondant on top.  Beh, I'm not a fan of thick fondant.  If you make your way to the inner Richmond area, you have to try the Swedish Princess Cake from Schubert's Bakery--this one's really tasty.  

I also tried the Chocolate Truffle Cake because I am a chocolate fiend; but this slice left me thinking, "there's really chocolate ganache in this?"  I prefer the Chocolate Truffle Slice from Stella Pastry & Cafe around the corner.  

The things I would come back to get are the Plain Coconut Macaroon and the Amaretti Plain Cookie.  Coconut Macaroon = Yummy! and packed with flavor; this little guy has weight to it so at $19.95/lb, it can be pricey.  However, the Amaretti is smaller/ lighter so I was able to get about 8 pcs for about $2.85.

FYI--$10 minimum when using card.
author: Doreen M.

description: This review is in regard to their service not their food. Hopefully this is just a one time thing but I went in the afternoon to get some dessert to a dinner I was going to. The woman behind the counter did not seem like she was happy to see me. I asked her a question and got an "uh huh" response. I ask her for one more task to box and cut my dessert so I thanked her and got another "uh huh". Am I asking too much for a freaking thank you!? I may be overreacting it but they are a small business, they should be thanking everyone who comes in to give them business....all I wanted was a brief "thank you"
author: Slim C.

description:
I have known of this place for as long as I can remember, but I've never had the urge to come in and give anything a try.

Finally, I decided to give Victoria's a try.

We ordered:

PRINCESS CAKE: I've had princess cakes before, but this one did not meet my expectations.  The marzipan was too thick for my liking, the cake was kind of on the dry side.  It wasn't spongy or fluffy enough for me.  Their custard seemed like custard pudding.  It wasn't ALL that, it was alright.

TIRIMISU CAKE: I enjoyed this a lot more than the princess cake.  I love the fluffiness of the cake and the consistency of the marscapone cheese.  I felt that they lacked something in it, although I don't know what.  But overall I loved it.

Next time, I want to give the cream puff's and the St. Honore cake a try.
author: Sarah F.

description: Had their panna cota, it was just average. Their st. Honre was also ok. Their cakes are made interestingly but just not super good. Okay priced.
author: Carrie T.

description:
I remember going to this place when I was a little girl.  They used to have little old italian ladies behind the counters.  Totally love their St. Honore cakes.  They also make a mean fruit tart.

Recently dropped in for some cookies.  Very pricey for 1/2 dozen.  The cookies are ok.  I just go back for nostalgia!
author: Wendy H.

description:
Here I have my final cannolo of the trip.  A nice woman in her sixties heads to the back to fill the cannolo.  This one is sweeter than nearly every one I've tried thus far but still not a "diabetic's nightmare".  There is WAY too much powdered sugar on the shell so I brush almost all of it off with a napkin.  

It is an extremely pretty cannolo, second only to Cavalli's in the "work of art" category.  A maraschino cherry is in each end with a noticeable but light cream cheese taste and not a lot of "tang" present.  
  
The cream is ultra smooth and for the "tangy" style of cannolo this cream is my favorite in SF.  There is a single "mystery chocolate chip" inside.  This is not an overly complex cannolo as there is not any citrus or liqueur taste.  The shell is okay and crunchy but rather delicate and flimsy and not very tasty.  

I purchase some great looking homemade torrone candy on my way out but still haven't eaten it as I'm saving it for a rainy day.
author: David E.

description:
Yum! The best bakery ever! I come here to get desserts for all  the special occasions!
A little expensive but really worth every penny.
author: Betty I.

description:
The Best Friends got their wedding cake here almost a quarter of a century ago.  That is how I heard of Victoria Pastry Company.  

Since then, I have gotten birthday cakes, celebration cakes and of course, cream puffs here.  They also sell Perugia chocolate here, i.e. the Baci candy of dark chocolate and hazelnut.  When I feel like taking the longer stroll through Chinatown and North Beach after Sts. Peter and Paul, I will stop here for the cream puff and the cappuccino.

The cream puffs are delicious here as well.  I agree with Denise M. about the cream puff--forget about Beard Papa's.  It's all about the whipped cream, not the custard.

Being that this a French/Italian bakery, hmmm--I feel like I am between France and Italy when I come here.

I hope The Best Friends get their 25th Anniversary Cake here next year.  I can hardly wait to have four little slices at the celebration like I did when they exchanged their vows.
author: Chiara A.

description:
We found Victoria Pastry Company while watching something on the Food Network - can't remember what it was, because I was mesmerized by what VPC had to offer!

We made our first trip there last year and took back a few of those stunning hand painted Easter eggs (read: I gingerly carried them on the plane with me, careful not to let anyone even breathe on them).  We didn't actually *try* anything on that trip (sadly).  This year?  Different story!  We went back for those gorgeous eggs again (had them shipped to our lucky recipients this time! The girl behind the counter was so helpful!!) and got a piece of princess cake (what? I am a princess!).  And this cake was fit for a princess!  Beautifully soft sponge cake with a dreamy cream filling in the center.  Literally melted in your mouth.  Even the fondant was yummy!  It was love, pure love.  I missed that cake right after the last bite.  Will be back for more!!
author: Linda B.

description:
$3.75 for a slice of tiramisu at the northwest corner of Washington Square. 

Prompt service and the slice portion is perfect to share for two.
author: daphne w.

description: The eclare's glaze was gritty (over cooked I guess). Croissant:  dry, over cooked. Coffee was perfect! Nice seating outside.
author: Rich F.

description: Craving  some desert and picked up a sliced of their chocolate cake topped with chocolate shavings.  It  was good and I specially enjoy the fact that it was not  too repugnant sweet.
author: Manny R.

description: Coffee is terrible. Pastry selection was pretty slim. Service was friendly and nice. Overall, not really impressed at all with Victorias
author: Chris W.

description: The pastries, cookies, and cakes (whole or by the slice) are all delicious.  Light, fluffy, flaky...due I'm sure to all the butter! I stop here several times a week for a morning pastry or an after dinner piece of cake or a box of Italian cookies for the office.  Definitely worth a special trip if you're in North Beach or in the city.
author: Grace K.

description:
Chocolate lovers: get the Chocolate Truffle Cake. Rich, creamy, enough to satisfy cravings. So, SOOOO gooood!

Want something lighter? Go with the Princess Cake. Not only is it pretty, the sponge cake and raspberry filling is SO delicious!

Try and you will not regret!
author: Tina T.

description:
Seriously,

I have had almost no better cakes than those from Victoria Pastry. We order them for our monthly office birthday celebration and nearly every one we've had has been utterly delicious. Of course the Princess cake wins first prize, but we recently tried the Chocolate Fedora and I cannot even put into simply type here how sumptuous is really was. It's important to note I have never been to the physical shop itself, but the cakes are so good, it warrants a 5 star rating from me!
author: Thomas K.

description:
Ordered a cassata cake for my son"s second birthday ...IT was the BEST ever......We still drool at the thought.  Better than Hoboken, New Jersey or in Little Italy , New York!!! 
We always get a cassata cake for special occasions,,,,,,now we know where to go.!!!!
author: Cara L.

description:
the pastries are good. can get a bit pricey. the people are hit or miss. sometimes theyre nice, sometimes they seem like they dont want to be there. they arent always open during their posted hours. so maybe call ahead. 

i come for the princess cake and cheesecake and another one i cant think of. but the canolis and eclairs arent anything special.
author: JeF m.

description: Truth be told, I've only had the princess cake, but it was so good that it alone warrants four stars. The pastries all look gorgeous and the next time I'm in North Beach I'll definitely come back to try something else (and will also get a princess cake slice and not think about it too hard). Great service too!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Get the tiramisu or the Napoleon...both are light yet decadent desserts that go perfectly with an espresso. The Napoleon had flaky layers of pastry with fresh sweet cream between them with a chocolate ganache-like layer on top. The tiramisu was moist and light, with rich flavors of espresso and a light finish of rum. 

I saw what appeared to be a little old Italian grandmother bustling about behind the counter, so cute! And a good sign, if you ask me. It seems a little on the pricey side but well worth the occasional drop-in.  They package to-go items in boxes with white string wrapped around it. Old school charm, I like!
author: Kristen S.

description: I just ordered a princess cake for my 40th bday and it was fantastic. We also had the princess cake at our wedding reception, and instead of freezing the top layer, the Victoria Pastry shop gives you a coupon to come in and get a fresh cake on your one year anniversary. So I've had the princess cake on three occasions, and it was fantastic every time. We also ordered the cookies - mixed assortment - and they got rave reviews at our party.
author: Kerry L.

description:
I order their famous Saint Honore Cake for special occasions and it's always a hit. Cream puffs on top of a cake? Awesome.

If you're looking for a traditional cake that tastes awesome, come here. Tiramisu is also great.
author: vicki c.

description:
Two items that keeps me coming back! Their red velvet cake and napoleon pastries!!!!

Ben LOVES their napoleon, nicely chilled, not too sweet and just perfect!

We recently also came upon their red velvet cakes....first their cupcakes...the frosting is also filled inside them, so you get double the goodness! We went around Valentine's Day so their red velvet cake was also available. 

You probably can't go wrong with any of their goodies, so go make that trip over!
author: Jenny T.

description: The world's best custard Napoleons!!  Give them a try.
author: Briar S.

description: Absolutely love their Cappucino and St. Honore cake!  If only I didn't have to deal with bad customer service most of the time I go there, I'd give them a higher rating.  Take my advice, if you want to be acknowledged at all and get any kind of decent service, don't forget to bring an Italian with you.
author: Danielle O.

description:
If you need to bring dessert to impress someone. Get Saint Honore Cake.
They been baking this cake for years (30)  Best to order ahead. I believe they have small and large size. Enjoy...
author: k j.

description:
A true neighborhood destination, this bakery has been here forever.  My first experience here was my sister's wedding cake, their famed St. Honore's cake - think multiple cream puffs bunched into a round cake, but filled with custard instead of whip cream (gee.. sounds like Beard Papa's) and topped with halved marachino cherries.  It was a kid's delight, especially when my favorite drink was a Shirley Temple... love dem cherries.  Today, I had three things in mind, but they only had two available:    
                     1.  Mini Palmiers - purchased a half pound of freshly made
                          "butterflies" as we called them as kids.  Great with coffee
                           for breakfast or general munching.
                     2.  Tiramisu - saving it for breakfast, but should be good 
                           since they now own Stella ("best in town")
                     3.  Chocolate half/half cookies - didn't have this today so I 
                           passed on their substitutes; this is a chocolate butter
                           cookie that is chocolate covered on one side and not on
                           the other.

No, I didn't get their signature pastries, but they have a hearty selection of biscottis, cookies, bear claws, tarts, and croissants to choose from.  My purchase came to $19.00 which is no bargain compared to the Chinese bakeries a few blocks away; but the quality and flavor justify the added cost.  You get a variety of customers ranging from dine-in (small tables inside and out), family take home buyers (whole cakes), or breakfast munchers like me.  No, I didn't eat them all in one sitting and I did share.  Nothing like peeking in the fridge and finding something worth satisfying your hunger.  I miss you Tiramisu!
author: Mike C.

description: New location but same wonderful pastries.  (I see someone downgraded it to 1 star because of the move, but landlords don't always renew leases.)  Be careful -- their website victoriapastry.com still shows their old Stockton address, but they're not there.  Bottom line:  I go out of my way every trip to SF to buy their Princess Cake.  Can easily become one of your favorite SF landmarks.
author: Mike H.

description:
As a Princess Cake expert I would just like to say Victoria Pastry Company has got it right on the nose! Absolutely delectable. 

Oh & their hot cocoa is great too.
author: Caitlin M.

description: I brought a bear claw. I just want to try it like less the two dollars.
author: John F.

description: Probably the best latte I've ever had. Staff is young, cute and helpful. Even if you don't need any pastries, stop in for the coffee. They're my morning go-to.
author: Sonja K.

description:
Terrible service.  I received many high recommendations by older (native) San Franciscans about this bakery, but perhaps their experiences were from the past.  I heard Victoria's grand-kids are running the place now and they are only interested in making a buck.  

If you are a tourist looking for something tasty to try and its near closing time, please do not go here!  The staff will rush you out the door even though there are tables and chairs.  We were obviously tourists who wanted to try the much acclaimed St Honore Cake that everyone talks about, but the staff won't even give you plastic forks and paper plates as they quickly push you out the door.  We had to go two blocks down to a coffee shop who was nice enough to give us plastic cutlery and plates even though we didn't order anything from them initially.

Cookies by the pound are overpriced.  Definitely NOT going back!
author: Phuong D.

description: St. Honoré Cake - good, but the cream puffs were a bit soggy....
author: Jess H.

description: I am a fan of St. Honore cakes, and our tradition is to get one for my birthday. We drove to Victoria's Bakery from North Bay to get one, having heard they were delicious (and a shout out in Via magazine). It is the worst cake I've ever eaten. the "flaky" crust was not flaky, and the frozen cream puffs from Costco are better than the ones on the cake. They say they bake them every day, but there is no way that the St. Honore Cake we picked up was fresh. I should really give them one star, just as most reviewers pointed out, the service was non-existent...we walked in and were greeted with a indifferent, bored look, like "what?" Won't go back.
author: Erica S.

description:
